    2271             : namespace Catch {
    2272             : 
    2273             :     struct Counts {
    2274          23 :         Counts() : passed( 0 ), failed( 0 ), failedButOk( 0 ) {}
    2275             : 
    2276           8 :         Counts operator - ( Counts const& other ) const {
    2277           8 :             Counts diff;
    2278           8 :             diff.passed = passed - other.passed;
    2279           8 :             diff.failed = failed - other.failed;
    2280           8 :             diff.failedButOk = failedButOk - other.failedButOk;
    2281           8 :             return diff;
    2282             :         }
    2283           3 :         Counts& operator += ( Counts const& other ) {
    2284           3 :             passed += other.passed;
    2285           3 :             failed += other.failed;
    2286           3 :             failedButOk += other.failedButOk;
    2287           3 :             return *this;
    2288             :         }
    2289             : 
    2290          12 :         std::size_t total() const {
    2291          12 :             return passed + failed + failedButOk;
    2292             :         }
    2293           2 :         bool allPassed() const {
    2294           2 :             return failed == 0 && failedButOk == 0;
    2295             :         }
    2296           0 :         bool allOk() const {
    2297           0 :             return failed == 0;
    2298             :         }
    2299             : 
    2300             :         std::size_t passed;
    2301             :         std::size_t failed;
    2302             :         std::size_t failedButOk;
    2303             :     };
    2304             : 
    2305           3 :     struct Totals {
    2306             : 
    2307           1 :         Totals operator - ( Totals const& other ) const {
    2308           1 :             Totals diff;
    2309           1 :             diff.assertions = assertions - other.assertions;
    2310           1 :             diff.testCases = testCases - other.testCases;
    2311           1 :             return diff;
    2312             :         }
    2313             : 
    2314           1 :         Totals delta( Totals const& prevTotals ) const {
    2315           1 :             Totals diff = *this - prevTotals;
    2316           1 :             if( diff.assertions.failed > 0 )
    2317           0 :                 ++diff.testCases.failed;
    2318           1 :             else if( diff.assertions.failedButOk > 0 )
    2319           0 :                 ++diff.testCases.failedButOk;
    2320             :             else
    2321           1 :                 ++diff.testCases.passed;
    2322           1 :             return diff;
    2323             :         }
    2324             : 
    2325           1 :         Totals& operator += ( Totals const& other ) {

    2327           1 :             testCases += other.testCases;
    2328           1 :             return *this;

    2424             : // #included from: internal/catch_generators.hpp
    2425             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_GENERATORS_HPP_INCLUDED
    2426             : 
    2427             : #include <vector>
    2428             : #include <string>
    2429             : #include <stdlib.h>
    2430             : 
    2431             : namespace Catch {
    2432             : 
    2433             : template<typename T>
    2434             : struct IGenerator {
    2435             :     virtual ~IGenerator() {}
    2436             :     virtual T getValue( std::size_t index ) const = 0;
    2437             :     virtual std::size_t size () const = 0;
    2438             : };
    2439             : 
    2440             : template<typename T>
    2441             : class BetweenGenerator : public IGenerator<T> {
    2442             : public:
    2443             :     BetweenGenerator( T from, T to ) : m_from( from ), m_to( to ){}
    2444             : 
    2445             :     virtual T getValue( std::size_t index ) const {
    2446             :         return m_from+static_cast<int>( index );
    2447             :     }
    2448             : 
    2449             :     virtual std::size_t size() const {
    2450             :         return static_cast<std::size_t>( 1+m_to-m_from );
    2451             :     }
    2452             : 
    2453             : private:
    2454             : 
    2455             :     T m_from;
    2456             :     T m_to;
    2457             : };
    2458             : 
    2459             : template<typename T>
    2460             : class ValuesGenerator : public IGenerator<T> {
    2461             : public:
    2462             :     ValuesGenerator(){}
    2463             : 
    2464             :     void add( T value ) {
    2465             :         m_values.push_back( value );
    2466             :     }
    2467             : 
    2468             :     virtual T getValue( std::size_t index ) const {
    2469             :         return m_values[index];
    2470             :     }
    2471             : 
    2472             :     virtual std::size_t size() const {
    2473             :         return m_values.size();
    2474             :     }
    2475             : 
    2476             : private:
    2477             :     std::vector<T> m_values;
    2478             : };
    2479             : 
    2480             : template<typename T>
    2481             : class CompositeGenerator {
    2482             : public:
    2483             :     CompositeGenerator() : m_totalSize( 0 ) {}
    2484             : 
    2485             :     // *** Move semantics, similar to auto_ptr ***
    2486             :     CompositeGenerator( CompositeGenerator& other )
    2487             :     :   m_fileInfo( other.m_fileInfo ),
    2488             :         m_totalSize( 0 )
    2489             :     {
    2490             :         move( other );
    2491             :     }
    2492             : 
    2493             :     CompositeGenerator& setFileInfo( const char* fileInfo ) {
    2494             :         m_fileInfo = fileInfo;
    2495             :         return *this;
    2496             :     }
    2497             : 
    2498             :     ~CompositeGenerator() {
    2499             :         deleteAll( m_composed );
    2500             :     }
    2501             : 
    2502             :     operator T () const {
    2503             :         size_t overallIndex = getCurrentContext().getGeneratorIndex( m_fileInfo, m_totalSize );
    2504             : 
    2505             :         typename std::vector<const IGenerator<T>*>::const_iterator it = m_composed.begin();
    2506             :         typename std::vector<const IGenerator<T>*>::const_iterator itEnd = m_composed.end();
    2507             :         for( size_t index = 0; it != itEnd; ++it )
    2508             :         {
    2509             :             const IGenerator<T>* generator = *it;
    2510             :             if( overallIndex >= index && overallIndex < index + generator->size() )
    2511             :             {
    2512             :                 return generator->getValue( overallIndex-index );
    2513             :             }
    2514             :             index += generator->size();
    2515             :         }
    2516             :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Indexed past end of generated range" );
    2517             :         return T(); // Suppress spurious "not all control paths return a value" warning in Visual Studio - if you know how to fix this please do so
    2518             :     }
    2519             : 
    2520             :     void add( const IGenerator<T>* generator ) {
    2521             :         m_totalSize += generator->size();
    2522             :         m_composed.push_back( generator );
    2523             :     }
    2524             : 
    2525             :     CompositeGenerator& then( CompositeGenerator& other ) {
    2526             :         move( other );
    2527             :         return *this;
    2528             :     }
    2529             : 
    2530             :     CompositeGenerator& then( T value ) {
    2531             :         ValuesGenerator<T>* valuesGen = new ValuesGenerator<T>();
    2532             :         valuesGen->add( value );
    2533             :         add( valuesGen );
    2534             :         return *this;
    2535             :     }
    2536             : 
    2537             : private:
    2538             : 
    2539             :     void move( CompositeGenerator& other ) {
    2540             :         m_composed.insert( m_composed.end(), other.m_composed.begin(), other.m_composed.end() );
    2541             :         m_totalSize += other.m_totalSize;
    2542             :         other.m_composed.clear();
    2543             :     }
    2544             : 
    2545             :     std::vector<const IGenerator<T>*> m_composed;
    2546             :     std::string m_fileInfo;
    2547             :     size_t m_totalSize;
    2548             : };
    2549             : 
    2550             : namespace Generators
    2551             : {
    2552             :     template<typename T>
    2553             :     CompositeGenerator<T> between( T from, T to ) {
    2554             :         CompositeGenerator<T> generators;
    2555             :         generators.add( new BetweenGenerator<T>( from, to ) );
    2556             :         return generators;
    2557             :     }
    2558             : 
    2559             :     template<typename T>
    2560             :     CompositeGenerator<T> values( T val1, T val2 ) {
    2561             :         CompositeGenerator<T> generators;
    2562             :         ValuesGenerator<T>* valuesGen = new ValuesGenerator<T>();
    2563             :         valuesGen->add( val1 );
    2564             :         valuesGen->add( val2 );
    2565             :         generators.add( valuesGen );
    2566             :         return generators;
    2567             :     }
    2568             : 
    2569             :     template<typename T>
    2570             :     CompositeGenerator<T> values( T val1, T val2, T val3 ){
    2571             :         CompositeGenerator<T> generators;
    2572             :         ValuesGenerator<T>* valuesGen = new ValuesGenerator<T>();
    2573             :         valuesGen->add( val1 );
    2574             :         valuesGen->add( val2 );
    2575             :         valuesGen->add( val3 );
    2576             :         generators.add( valuesGen );
    2577             :         return generators;
    2578             :     }
    2579             : 
    2580             :     template<typename T>
    2581             :     CompositeGenerator<T> values( T val1, T val2, T val3, T val4 ) {
    2582             :         CompositeGenerator<T> generators;
    2583             :         ValuesGenerator<T>* valuesGen = new ValuesGenerator<T>();
    2584             :         valuesGen->add( val1 );
    2585             :         valuesGen->add( val2 );
    2586             :         valuesGen->add( val3 );
    2587             :         valuesGen->add( val4 );
    2588             :         generators.add( valuesGen );
    2589             :         return generators;
    2590             :     }
    2591             : 
    2592             : } // end namespace Generators
    2593             : 
    2594             : using namespace Generators;
    2595             : 
    2596             : } // end namespace Catch

    2669             :         template<typename T>

    2671             :         public:
    2672             : 
    2673             :             ExceptionTranslator( std::string(*translateFunction)( T& ) )
    2674             :             : m_translateFunction( translateFunction )
    2675             :             {}
    2676             : 
    2677             :             virtual std::string translate( ExceptionTranslators::const_iterator it, ExceptionTranslators::const_iterator itEnd ) const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    2678             :                 try {
    2679             :                     if( it == itEnd )
    2680             :                         throw;
    2681             :                     else
    2682             :                         return (*it)->translate( it+1, itEnd );
    2683             :                 }
    2684             :                 catch( T& ex ) {
    2685             :                     return m_translateFunction( ex );
    2686             :                 }
    2687             :             }
    2688             : 
    2689             :         protected:
    2690             :             std::string(*m_translateFunction)( T& );
    2691             :         };
    2692             : 
    2693             :     public:

    2696             :             getMutableRegistryHub().registerTranslator
    2697             :                 ( new ExceptionTranslator<T>( translateFunction ) );
    2698             :         }
    2699             :     };

    2720             : namespace Catch {
    2721             : namespace Detail {
    2722             : 
    2723             :     class Approx {
    2724             :     public:
    2725             :         explicit Approx ( double value )
    2726             :         :   m_epsilon( std::numeric_limits<float>::epsilon()*100 ),
    2727             :             m_margin( 0.0 ),
    2728             :             m_scale( 1.0 ),
    2729             :             m_value( value )
    2730             :         {}
    2731             : 
    2732             :         static Approx custom() {
    2733             :             return Approx( 0 );
    2734             :         }
    2735             : 
    2736             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_TYPE_TRAITS)
    2737             : 
    2738             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2739             :         Approx operator()( T value ) {
    2740             :             Approx approx( static_cast<double>(value) );
    2741             :             approx.epsilon( m_epsilon );
    2742             :             approx.margin( m_margin );
    2743             :             approx.scale( m_scale );
    2744             :             return approx;
    2745             :         }
    2746             : 
    2747             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2748             :         explicit Approx( T value ): Approx(static_cast<double>(value))
    2749             :         {}
    2750             : 
    2751             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2752             :         friend bool operator == ( const T& lhs, Approx const& rhs ) {
    2753             :             // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining this formula
    2754             :             auto lhs_v = double(lhs);
    2755             :             bool relativeOK = std::fabs(lhs_v - rhs.m_value) < rhs.m_epsilon * (rhs.m_scale + (std::max)(std::fabs(lhs_v), std::fabs(rhs.m_value)));
    2756             :             if (relativeOK) {
    2757             :                 return true;
    2758             :             }
    2759             :             return std::fabs(lhs_v - rhs.m_value) < rhs.m_margin;
    2760             :         }
    2761             : 
    2762             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2763             :         friend bool operator == ( Approx const& lhs, const T& rhs ) {
    2764             :             return operator==( rhs, lhs );
    2765             :         }
    2766             : 
    2767             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2768             :         friend bool operator != ( T lhs, Approx const& rhs ) {
    2769             :             return !operator==( lhs, rhs );
    2770             :         }
    2771             : 
    2772             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2773             :         friend bool operator != ( Approx const& lhs, T rhs ) {
    2774             :             return !operator==( rhs, lhs );
    2775             :         }
    2776             : 
    2777             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2778             :         friend bool operator <= ( T lhs, Approx const& rhs ) {
    2779             :             return double(lhs) < rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs;
    2780             :         }
    2781             : 
    2782             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2783             :         friend bool operator <= ( Approx const& lhs, T rhs ) {
    2784             :             return lhs.m_value < double(rhs) || lhs == rhs;
    2785             :         }
    2786             : 
    2787             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2788             :         friend bool operator >= ( T lhs, Approx const& rhs ) {
    2789             :             return double(lhs) > rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs;
    2790             :         }
    2791             : 
    2792             :         template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type>
    2793             :         friend bool operator >= ( Approx const& lhs, T rhs ) {
    2794             :             return lhs.m_value > double(rhs) || lhs == rhs;
    2795             :         }
    2796             :

    2799             :             m_epsilon = double(newEpsilon);
    2800             :             return *this;
    2801             :         }

    2812             :             return *this;
    2813             :         }

    2820             :             approx.margin( m_margin );
    2821             :             approx.scale( m_scale );
    2822             :             return approx;
    2823             :         }
    2824             :

    2826             :             // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining this formula
    2827             :             bool relativeOK = std::fabs( lhs - rhs.m_value ) < rhs.m_epsilon * (rhs.m_scale + (std::max)( std::fabs(lhs), std::fabs(rhs.m_value) ) );

    2829             :                 return true;

    2847             :             return lhs < rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs;
    2848             :         }

    2851             :             return lhs.m_value < rhs || lhs == rhs;

    2855             :             return lhs > rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs;
    2856             :         }

    2859             :             return lhs.m_value > rhs || lhs == rhs;
    2860             :         }

    2863             :             m_epsilon = newEpsilon;
    2864             :             return *this;
    2865             :         }

    2955             : // #included from: internal/catch_matchers_vector.h

    2957             : 
    2958             : namespace Catch {
    2959             : namespace Matchers {
    2960             : 
    2961             :     namespace Vector {
    2962             : 
    2963             :         template<typename T>
    2964             :         struct ContainsElementMatcher : MatcherBase<std::vector<T>, T> {
    2965             : 
    2966             :             ContainsElementMatcher(T const &comparator) : m_comparator( comparator) {}
    2967             : 
    2968             :             bool match(std::vector<T> const &v) const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    2969             :                 return std::find(v.begin(), v.end(), m_comparator) != v.end();
    2970             :             }
    2971             : 
    2972             :             virtual std::string describe() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    2973             :                 return "Contains: " + Catch::toString( m_comparator );
    2974             :             }
    2975             : 
    2976             :             T const& m_comparator;
    2977             :         };
    2978             : 
    2979             :         template<typename T>
    2980             :         struct ContainsMatcher : MatcherBase<std::vector<T>, std::vector<T> > {
    2981             : 
    2982             :             ContainsMatcher(std::vector<T> const &comparator) : m_comparator( comparator ) {}
    2983             : 
    2984             :             bool match(std::vector<T> const &v) const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    2985             :                 // !TBD: see note in EqualsMatcher
    2986             :                 if (m_comparator.size() > v.size())
    2987             :                     return false;
    2988             :                 for (size_t i = 0; i < m_comparator.size(); ++i)
    2989             :                     if (std::find(v.begin(), v.end(), m_comparator[i]) == v.end())
    2990             :                         return false;
    2991             :                 return true;
    2992             :             }
    2993             :             virtual std::string describe() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    2994             :                 return "Contains: " + Catch::toString( m_comparator );
    2995             :             }
    2996             : 
    2997             :             std::vector<T> const& m_comparator;
    2998             :         };
    2999             : 
    3000             :         template<typename T>
    3001             :         struct EqualsMatcher : MatcherBase<std::vector<T>, std::vector<T> > {
    3002             : 
    3003             :             EqualsMatcher(std::vector<T> const &comparator) : m_comparator( comparator ) {}
    3004             : 
    3005             :             bool match(std::vector<T> const &v) const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    3006             :                 // !TBD: This currently works if all elements can be compared using !=
    3007             :                 // - a more general approach would be via a compare template that defaults
    3008             :                 // to using !=. but could be specialised for, e.g. std::vector<T> etc
    3009             :                 // - then just call that directly
    3010             :                 if (m_comparator.size() != v.size())
    3011             :                     return false;
    3012             :                 for (size_t i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i)
    3013             :                     if (m_comparator[i] != v[i])
    3014             :                         return false;
    3015             :                 return true;
    3016             :             }
    3017             :             virtual std::string describe() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    3018             :                 return "Equals: " + Catch::toString( m_comparator );
    3019             :             }
    3020             :             std::vector<T> const& m_comparator;
    3021             :         };
    3022             : 
    3023             :     } // namespace Vector
    3024             : 
    3025             :     // The following functions create the actual matcher objects.
    3026             :     // This allows the types to be inferred
    3027             : 
    3028             :     template<typename T>
    3029             :     Vector::ContainsMatcher<T> Contains( std::vector<T> const& comparator ) {
    3030             :         return Vector::ContainsMatcher<T>( comparator );
    3031             :     }
    3032             :

    3035             :         return Vector::ContainsElementMatcher<T>( comparator );
    3036             :     }
    3037             :

    3040             :         return Vector::EqualsMatcher<T>( comparator );
    3041             :     }

    3072             : 
    3073             : namespace Catch {
    3074             : 
    3075             :     // An optional type
    3076             :     template<typename T>
    3077             :     class Option {
    3078             :     public:
    3079           4 :         Option() : nullableValue( CATCH_NULL ) {}
    3080           0 :         Option( T const& _value )
    3081           0 :         : nullableValue( new( storage ) T( _value ) )
    3082           0 :         {}
    3083             :         Option( Option const& _other )
    3084             :         : nullableValue( _other ? new( storage ) T( *_other ) : CATCH_NULL )
    3085             :         {}
    3086             : 
    3087           4 :         ~Option() {
    3088           4 :             reset();
    3089           4 :         }
    3090             : 
    3091             :         Option& operator= ( Option const& _other ) {
    3092             :             if( &_other != this ) {
    3093             :                 reset();
    3094             :                 if( _other )
    3095             :                     nullableValue = new( storage ) T( *_other );
    3096             :             }
    3097             :             return *this;
    3098             :         }
    3099           3 :         Option& operator = ( T const& _value ) {
    3100           3 :             reset();
    3101           3 :             nullableValue = new( storage ) T( _value );
    3102           3 :             return *this;
    3103             :         }
    3104             : 
    3105          12 :         void reset() {
    3106          12 :             if( nullableValue )
    3107           3 :                 nullableValue->~T();
    3108          12 :             nullableValue = CATCH_NULL;
    3109          12 :         }
    3110             : 
    3111           0 :         T& operator*() { return *nullableValue; }
    3112             :         T const& operator*() const { return *nullableValue; }
    3113           0 :         T* operator->() { return nullableValue; }
    3114             :         const T* operator->() const { return nullableValue; }
    3115             : 
    3116           0 :         T valueOr( T const& defaultValue ) const {
    3117           0 :             return nullableValue ? *nullableValue : defaultValue;
    3118             :         }
    3119             : 
    3120           1 :         bool some() const { return nullableValue != CATCH_NULL; }
    3121             :         bool none() const { return nullableValue == CATCH_NULL; }
    3122             : 
    3123             :         bool operator !() const { return nullableValue == CATCH_NULL; }
    3124           1 :         operator SafeBool::type() const {
    3125           1 :             return SafeBool::makeSafe( some() );
    3126             :         }
    3127             : 
    3128             :     private:
    3129             :         T *nullableValue;
    3130             :         union {
    3131             :             char storage[sizeof(T)];
    3132             : 
    3133             :             // These are here to force alignment for the storage
    3134             :             long double dummy1;
    3135             :             void (*dummy2)();
    3136             :             long double dummy3;
    3137             : #ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_LONG_LONG
    3138             :             long long dummy4;
    3139             : #endif
    3140             :         };
    3141             :     };
    3142             : 
    3143             : } // end namespace Catch

    3255             : // This protocol is really only here for (self) documenting purposes, since
    3256             : // all its methods are optional.

    3258             : 
    3259             : @optional
    3260             :

    3262             : -(void) tearDown;

    3268             :     class OcMethod : public SharedImpl<ITestCase> {
    3269             : 
    3270             :     public:
    3271             :         OcMethod( Class cls, SEL sel ) : m_cls( cls ), m_sel( sel ) {}
    3272             : 
    3273             :         virtual void invoke() const {
    3274             :             id obj = [[m_cls alloc] init];
    3275             : 
    3276             :             performOptionalSelector( obj, @selector(setUp)  );
    3277             :             performOptionalSelector( obj, m_sel );
    3278             :             performOptionalSelector( obj, @selector(tearDown)  );
    3279             : 
    3280             :             arcSafeRelease( obj );
    3281             :         }
    3282             :     private:
    3283             :         virtual ~OcMethod() {}
    3284             : 
    3285             :         Class m_cls;
    3286             :         SEL m_sel;
    3287             :     };
    3288             : 
    3289             :     namespace Detail{
    3290             : 
    3291             :         inline std::string getAnnotation(   Class cls,
    3292             :                                             std::string const& annotationName,
    3293             :                                             std::string const& testCaseName ) {
    3294             :             NSString* selStr = [[NSString alloc] initWithFormat:@"Catch_%s_%s", annotationName.c_str(), testCaseName.c_str()];
    3295             :             SEL sel = NSSelectorFromString( selStr );
    3296             :             arcSafeRelease( selStr );
    3297             :             id value = performOptionalSelector( cls, sel );
    3298             :             if( value )
    3299             :                 return [(NSString*)value UTF8String];
    3300             :             return "";
    3301             :         }
    3302             :     }
    3303             : 
    3304             :     inline size_t registerTestMethods() {
    3305             :         size_t noTestMethods = 0;
    3306             :         int noClasses = objc_getClassList( CATCH_NULL, 0 );
    3307             : 
    3308             :         Class* classes = (CATCH_UNSAFE_UNRETAINED Class *)malloc( sizeof(Class) * noClasses);
    3309             :         objc_getClassList( classes, noClasses );
    3310             : 
    3311             :         for( int c = 0; c < noClasses; c++ ) {
    3312             :             Class cls = classes[c];
    3313             :             {
    3314             :                 u_int count;
    3315             :                 Method* methods = class_copyMethodList( cls, &count );
    3316             :                 for( u_int m = 0; m < count ; m++ ) {
    3317             :                     SEL selector = method_getName(methods[m]);
    3318             :                     std::string methodName = sel_getName(selector);
    3319             :                     if( startsWith( methodName, "Catch_TestCase_" ) ) {
    3320             :                         std::string testCaseName = methodName.substr( 15 );
    3321             :                         std::string name = Detail::getAnnotation( cls, "Name", testCaseName );
    3322             :                         std::string desc = Detail::getAnnotation( cls, "Description", testCaseName );
    3323             :                         const char* className = class_getName( cls );
    3324             : 
    3325             :                         getMutableRegistryHub().registerTest( makeTestCase( new OcMethod( cls, selector ), className, name.c_str(), desc.c_str(), SourceLineInfo() ) );
    3326             :                         noTestMethods++;
    3327             :                     }
    3328             :                 }
    3329             :                 free(methods);
    3330             :             }
    3331             :         }
    3332             :         return noTestMethods;
    3333             :     }

    3343             :                     arcSafeRelease( m_substr );

    3347             :                     return false;
    3348             :                 }

    3351             :             };
    3352             : 
    3353             :             struct Equals : StringHolder {
    3354             :                 Equals( NSString* substr ) : StringHolder( substr ){}
    3355             : 
    3356             :                 virtual bool match( NSString* str ) const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    3357             :                     return  (str != nil || m_substr == nil ) &&
    3358             :                             [str isEqualToString:m_substr];

    3362             :                     return "equals string: " + Catch::toString( m_substr );
    3363             :                 }
    3364             :             };

    3367             :                 Contains( NSString* substr ) : StringHolder( substr ){}

    3370             :                     return  (str != nil || m_substr == nil ) &&
    3371             :                             [str rangeOfString:m_substr].location != NSNotFound;
    3372             :                 }

    3376             :                 }

    3383             :                     return  (str != nil || m_substr == nil ) &&
    3384             :                             [str rangeOfString:m_substr].location == 0;
    3385             :                 }

    3387             :                 virtual std::string describe() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    3388             :                     return "starts with: " + Catch::toString( m_substr );
    3389             :                 }
    3390             :             };
    3391             :             struct EndsWith : StringHolder {
    3392             :                 EndsWith( NSString* substr ) : StringHolder( substr ){}

    3394             :                 virtual bool match( NSString* str ) const {
    3395             :                     return  (str != nil || m_substr == nil ) &&
    3396             :                             [str rangeOfString:m_substr].location == [str length] - [m_substr length];
    3397             :                 }
    3398             : 
    3399             :                 virtual std::string describe() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    3400             :                     return "ends with: " + Catch::toString( m_substr );
    3401             :                 }
    3402             :             };

    3445             : public:
    3446             :     LeakDetector() {
    3447             :         int flag = _CrtSetDbgFlag(_CRTDBG_REPORT_FLAG);
    3448             :         flag |= _CRTDBG_LEAK_CHECK_DF;
    3449             :         flag |= _CRTDBG_ALLOC_MEM_DF;
    3450             :         _CrtSetDbgFlag(flag);
    3451             :         _CrtSetReportMode(_CRT_WARN, _CRTDBG_MODE_FILE | _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG);
    3452             :         _CrtSetReportFile(_CRT_WARN, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
    3453             :         // Change this to leaking allocation's number to break there
    3454             :         _CrtSetBreakAlloc(-1);
    3455             :     }
    3456             : };

    3502             : #include <stdexcept>
    3503             : 
    3504             : namespace Catch
    3505             : {
    3506             :     class WildcardPattern {
    3507             :         enum WildcardPosition {
    3508             :             NoWildcard = 0,
    3509             :             WildcardAtStart = 1,
    3510             :             WildcardAtEnd = 2,
    3511             :             WildcardAtBothEnds = WildcardAtStart | WildcardAtEnd
    3512             :         };
    3513             : 
    3514             :     public:
    3515             : 
    3516           0 :         WildcardPattern( std::string const& pattern, CaseSensitive::Choice caseSensitivity )
    3517           0 :         :   m_caseSensitivity( caseSensitivity ),
    3518             :             m_wildcard( NoWildcard ),
    3519           0 :             m_pattern( adjustCase( pattern ) )
    3520             :         {
    3521           0 :             if( startsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
    3522           0 :                 m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 1 );
    3523           0 :                 m_wildcard = WildcardAtStart;
    3524             :             }
    3525           0 :             if( endsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
    3526           0 :                 m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 0, m_pattern.size()-1 );
    3527           0 :                 m_wildcard = static_cast<WildcardPosition>( m_wildcard | WildcardAtEnd );
    3528             :             }
    3529           0 :         }
    3530             :         virtual ~WildcardPattern();
    3531           0 :         virtual bool matches( std::string const& str ) const {
    3532           0 :             switch( m_wildcard ) {
    3533           0 :                 case NoWildcard:
    3534           0 :                     return m_pattern == adjustCase( str );
    3535           0 :                 case WildcardAtStart:
    3536           0 :                     return endsWith( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
    3537           0 :                 case WildcardAtEnd:
    3538           0 :                     return startsWith( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
    3539           0 :                 case WildcardAtBothEnds:
    3540           0 :                     return contains( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
    3541             :             }
    3542             : 
    3543             : #ifdef __clang__
    3544             : #pragma clang diagnostic push
    3545             : #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunreachable-code"
    3546             : #endif
    3547           0 :             throw std::logic_error( "Unknown enum" );
    3548             : #ifdef __clang__
    3549             : #pragma clang diagnostic pop
    3550             : #endif
    3551             :         }
    3552             :     private:
    3553           0 :         std::string adjustCase( std::string const& str ) const {
    3554           0 :             return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No ? toLower( str ) : str;
    3555             :         }
    3556             :         CaseSensitive::Choice m_caseSensitivity;
    3557             :         WildcardPosition m_wildcard;
    3558             :         std::string m_pattern;
    3559             :     };
    3560             : }

    3562             : #include <string>
    3563             : #include <vector>

    3566             : 
    3567           9 :     class TestSpec {
    3568           2 :         struct Pattern : SharedImpl<> {
    3569             :             virtual ~Pattern();
    3570             :             virtual bool matches( TestCaseInfo const& testCase ) const = 0;
    3571             :         };
    3572             :         class NamePattern : public Pattern {
    3573             :         public:
    3574           0 :             NamePattern( std::string const& name )
    3575           0 :             : m_wildcardPattern( toLower( name ), CaseSensitive::No )
    3576           0 :             {}
    3577             :             virtual ~NamePattern();
    3578           0 :             virtual bool matches( TestCaseInfo const& testCase ) const {
    3579           0 :                 return m_wildcardPattern.matches( toLower( testCase.name ) );
    3580             :             }
    3581             :         private:
    3582             :             WildcardPattern m_wildcardPattern;
    3583             :         };
    3584             : 
    3585             :         class TagPattern : public Pattern {
    3586             :         public:
    3587           1 :             TagPattern( std::string const& tag ) : m_tag( toLower( tag ) ) {}
    3588             :             virtual ~TagPattern();
    3589           1 :             virtual bool matches( TestCaseInfo const& testCase ) const {
    3590           1 :                 return testCase.lcaseTags.find( m_tag ) != testCase.lcaseTags.end();
    3591             :             }
    3592             :         private:
    3593             :             std::string m_tag;
    3594             :         };
    3595             : 
    3596             :         class ExcludedPattern : public Pattern {
    3597             :         public:
    3598           1 :             ExcludedPattern( Ptr<Pattern> const& underlyingPattern ) : m_underlyingPattern( underlyingPattern ) {}
    3599             :             virtual ~ExcludedPattern();
    3600           1 :             virtual bool matches( TestCaseInfo const& testCase ) const { return !m_underlyingPattern->matches( testCase ); }
    3601             :         private:
    3602             :             Ptr<Pattern> m_underlyingPattern;
    3603             :         };
    3604             : 
    3605           9 :         struct Filter {
    3606             :             std::vector<Ptr<Pattern> > m_patterns;
    3607             : 
    3608           1 :             bool matches( TestCaseInfo const& testCase ) const {
    3609             :                 // All patterns in a filter must match for the filter to be a match
    3610           2 :                 for( std::vector<Ptr<Pattern> >::const_iterator it = m_patterns.begin(), itEnd = m_patterns.end(); it != itEnd; ++it ) {
    3611           1 :                     if( !(*it)->matches( testCase ) )
    3612           0 :                         return false;
    3613             :                 }
    3614           1 :                 return true;
    3615             :             }
    3616             :         };
    3617             : 
    3618             :     public:
    3619           1 :         bool hasFilters() const {
    3620           1 :             return !m_filters.empty();
    3621             :         }
    3622           1 :         bool matches( TestCaseInfo const& testCase ) const {
    3623             :             // A TestSpec matches if any filter matches
    3624           1 :             for( std::vector<Filter>::const_iterator it = m_filters.begin(), itEnd = m_filters.end(); it != itEnd; ++it )
    3625           1 :                 if( it->matches( testCase ) )
    3626           1 :                     return true;
    3627           0 :             return false;
    3628             :         }
    3629             :

    3657           1 :         TestSpecParser& parse( std::string const& arg ) {

    3670           1 :             addFilter();

    3674           3 :         void visitChar( char c ) {
    3675           3 :             if( m_mode == None ) {
    3676           2 :                 switch( c ) {
    3677           0 :                 case ' ': return;
    3678           1 :                 case '~': m_exclusion = true; return;
    3679           1 :                 case '[': return startNewMode( Tag, ++m_pos );
    3680           0 :                 case '"': return startNewMode( QuotedName, ++m_pos );
    3681           0 :                 case '\\': return escape();
    3682           0 :                 default: startNewMode( Name, m_pos ); break;
    3683             :                 }
    3684             :             }
    3685           1 :             if( m_mode == Name ) {
    3686           0 :                 if( c == ',' ) {
    3687           0 :                     addPattern<TestSpec::NamePattern>();
    3688           0 :                     addFilter();
    3689             :                 }
    3690           0 :                 else if( c == '[' ) {
    3691           0 :                     if( subString() == "exclude:" )
    3692           0 :                         m_exclusion = true;
    3693             :                     else
    3694           0 :                         addPattern<TestSpec::NamePattern>();
    3695           0 :                     startNewMode( Tag, ++m_pos );
    3696             :                 }
    3697           0 :                 else if( c == '\\' )
    3698           0 :                     escape();
    3699             :             }
    3700           1 :             else if( m_mode == EscapedName )
    3701           0 :                 m_mode = Name;
    3702           1 :             else if( m_mode == QuotedName && c == '"' )
    3703           0 :                 addPattern<TestSpec::NamePattern>();

    3714           0 :             m_mode = EscapedName;
    3715           0 :             m_escapeChars.push_back( m_pos );

    3717           1 :         std::string subString() const { return m_arg.substr( m_start, m_pos - m_start ); }

    3725           0 :                 m_exclusion = true;

    3727             :             }

    3734           1 :             m_exclusion = false;
    3735           1 :             m_mode = None;

    4087             :     struct TextAttributes {
    4088           0 :         TextAttributes()
    4089           0 :         :   initialIndent( std::string::npos ),
    4090             :             indent( 0 ),
    4091             :             width( consoleWidth-1 ),
    4092           0 :             tabChar( '\t' )
    4093           0 :         {}
    4094             : 
    4095             :         TextAttributes& setInitialIndent( std::size_t _value )  { initialIndent = _value; return *this; }
    4096           0 :         TextAttributes& setIndent( std::size_t _value )         { indent = _value; return *this; }
    4097           0 :         TextAttributes& setWidth( std::size_t _value )          { width = _value; return *this; }
    4098             :         TextAttributes& setTabChar( char _value )               { tabChar = _value; return *this; }
    4099             : 
    4100             :         std::size_t initialIndent;  // indent of first line, or npos
    4101             :         std::size_t indent;         // indent of subsequent lines, or all if initialIndent is npos
    4102             :         std::size_t width;          // maximum width of text, including indent. Longer text will wrap
    4103             :         char tabChar;               // If this char is seen the indent is changed to current pos
    4104             :     };
    4105             : 
    4106           0 :     class Text {
    4107             :     public:
    4108           0 :         Text( std::string const& _str, TextAttributes const& _attr = TextAttributes() )
    4109           0 :         : attr( _attr )
    4110             :         {
    4111           0 :             std::string wrappableChars = " [({.,/|\\-";
    4112           0 :             std::size_t indent = _attr.initialIndent != std::string::npos
    4113           0 :                 ? _attr.initialIndent
    4114             :                 : _attr.indent;
    4115           0 :             std::string remainder = _str;
    4116             : 
    4117           0 :             while( !remainder.empty() ) {
    4118           0 :                 if( lines.size() >= 1000 ) {
    4119           0 :                     lines.push_back( "... message truncated due to excessive size" );
    4120           0 :                     return;
    4121             :                 }
    4122           0 :                 std::size_t tabPos = std::string::npos;
    4123           0 :                 std::size_t width = (std::min)( remainder.size(), _attr.width - indent );
    4124           0 :                 std::size_t pos = remainder.find_first_of( '\n' );
    4125           0 :                 if( pos <= width ) {
    4126           0 :                     width = pos;
    4127             :                 }
    4128           0 :                 pos = remainder.find_last_of( _attr.tabChar, width );
    4129           0 :                 if( pos != std::string::npos ) {
    4130           0 :                     tabPos = pos;
    4131           0 :                     if( remainder[width] == '\n' )
    4132           0 :                         width--;
    4133           0 :                     remainder = remainder.substr( 0, tabPos ) + remainder.substr( tabPos+1 );
    4134             :                 }
    4135             : 
    4136           0 :                 if( width == remainder.size() ) {
    4137           0 :                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
    4138             :                 }
    4139           0 :                 else if( remainder[width] == '\n' ) {
    4140           0 :                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
    4141           0 :                     if( width <= 1 || remainder.size() != 1 )
    4142           0 :                         remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
    4143           0 :                     indent = _attr.indent;
    4144             :                 }
    4145             :                 else {
    4146           0 :                     pos = remainder.find_last_of( wrappableChars, width );
    4147           0 :                     if( pos != std::string::npos && pos > 0 ) {
    4148           0 :                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, pos );
    4149           0 :                         if( remainder[0] == ' ' )
    4150           0 :                             remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
    4151             :                     }
    4152             :                     else {
    4153           0 :                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, width-1 );
    4154           0 :                         lines.back() += "-";
    4155             :                     }
    4156           0 :                     if( lines.size() == 1 )
    4157           0 :                         indent = _attr.indent;
    4158           0 :                     if( tabPos != std::string::npos )
    4159           0 :                         indent += tabPos;
    4160             :                 }
    4161             :             }
    4162             :         }
    4163             : 
    4164           0 :         void spliceLine( std::size_t _indent, std::string& _remainder, std::size_t _pos ) {
    4165           0 :             lines.push_back( std::string( _indent, ' ' ) + _remainder.substr( 0, _pos ) );
    4166           0 :             _remainder = _remainder.substr( _pos );
    4167           0 :         }
    4168             : 
    4169             :         typedef std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator const_iterator;
    4170             : 
    4171             :         const_iterator begin() const { return lines.begin(); }
    4172             :         const_iterator end() const { return lines.end(); }
    4173             :         std::string const& last() const { return lines.back(); }
    4174           0 :         std::size_t size() const { return lines.size(); }
    4175           0 :         std::string const& operator[]( std::size_t _index ) const { return lines[_index]; }
    4176             :         std::string toString() const {
    4177             :             std::ostringstream oss;
    4178             :             oss << *this;
    4179             :             return oss.str();
    4180             :         }
    4181             : 
    4182             :         friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& _stream, Text const& _text ) {
    4183             :             for( Text::const_iterator it = _text.begin(), itEnd = _text.end();
    4184             :                 it != itEnd; ++it ) {

    4186             :                     _stream << "\n";

    4188             :             }

    4209             : #undef STITCH_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OPEN_NAMESPACE
    4210             : 
    4211             : // ----------- #included from clara_compilers.h -----------
    4212             : 
    4213             : #ifndef TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4214             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4215             : 
    4216             : // Detect a number of compiler features - mostly C++11/14 conformance - by compiler
    4217             : // The following features are defined:
    4218             : //
    4219             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR : is nullptr supported?
    4220             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT : is noexcept supported?
    4221             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS : The delete and default keywords for compiler generated methods
    4222             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE : is override supported?
    4223             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR : is unique_ptr supported (otherwise use auto_ptr)
    4224             : 
    4225             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OR_GREATER : Is C++11 supported?
    4226             : 
    4227             : // CLARA_CONFIG_VARIADIC_MACROS : are variadic macros supported?
    4228             : 
    4229             : // In general each macro has a _NO_<feature name> form
    4230             : // (e.g. CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NULLPTR) which disables the feature.
    4231             : // Many features, at point of detection, define an _INTERNAL_ macro, so they
    4232             : // can be combined, en-mass, with the _NO_ forms later.
    4233             : 
    4234             : // All the C++11 features can be disabled with CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11
    4235             : 
    4236             : #ifdef __clang__
    4237             : 
    4238             : #if __has_feature(cxx_nullptr)
    4239             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4240             : #endif
    4241             : 
    4242             : #if __has_feature(cxx_noexcept)
    4243             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4244             : #endif
    4245             : 
    4246             : #endif // __clang__
    4247             : 
    4248             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4249             : // GCC
    4250             : #ifdef __GNUC__
    4251             : 
    4252             : #if __GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 6 && defined(__GXX_EXPERIMENTAL_CXX0X__)
    4253             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4254             : #endif
    4255             : 
    4256             : // - otherwise more recent versions define __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4257             : // and will get picked up below
    4258             : 
    4259             : #endif // __GNUC__
    4260             : 
    4261             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4262             : // Visual C++
    4263             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    4264             : 
    4265             : #if (_MSC_VER >= 1600)
    4266             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4267             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4268             : #endif
    4269             : 
    4270             : #if (_MSC_VER >= 1900 ) // (VC++ 13 (VS2015))
    4271             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4272             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4273             : #endif
    4274             : 
    4275             : #endif // _MSC_VER
    4276             : 
    4277             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4278             : // C++ language feature support
    4279             : 
    4280             : // catch all support for C++11
    4281             : #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4282             : 
    4283             : #define CLARA_CPP11_OR_GREATER
    4284             : 
    4285             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR)
    4286             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4287             : #endif
    4288             : 
    4289             : #ifndef CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4290             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4291             : #endif
    4292             : 
    4293             : #ifndef CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4294             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4295             : #endif
    4296             : 
    4297             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE)
    4298             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4299             : #endif
    4300             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR)
    4301             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4302             : #endif
    4303             : 
    4304             : #endif // __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4305             : 
    4306             : // Now set the actual defines based on the above + anything the user has configured
    4307             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4308             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4309             : #endif
    4310             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4311             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4312             : #endif
    4313             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4314             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4315             : #endif
    4316             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4317             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4318             : #endif
    4319             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4320             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4321             : #endif
    4322             : 
    4323             : // noexcept support:
    4324             : #if defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_NOEXCEPT)
    4325             : #define CLARA_NOEXCEPT noexcept
    4326             : #  define CLARA_NOEXCEPT_IS(x) noexcept(x)
    4327             : #else
    4328             : #define CLARA_NOEXCEPT throw()
    4329             : #  define CLARA_NOEXCEPT_IS(x)
    4330             : #endif
    4331             : 
    4332             : // nullptr support
    4333             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4334             : #define CLARA_NULL nullptr
    4335             : #else
    4336             : #define CLARA_NULL NULL
    4337             : #endif
    4338             : 
    4339             : // override support
    4340             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4341             : #define CLARA_OVERRIDE override
    4342             : #else
    4343             : #define CLARA_OVERRIDE
    4344             : #endif
    4345             : 
    4346             : // unique_ptr support
    4347             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4348             : #   define CLARA_AUTO_PTR( T ) std::unique_ptr<T>
    4349             : #else
    4350             : #   define CLARA_AUTO_PTR( T ) std::auto_ptr<T>
    4351             : #endif
    4352             : 
    4353             : #endif // TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4354             : 
    4355             : // ----------- end of #include from clara_compilers.h -----------
    4356             : // ........... back in clara.h
    4357             :

    4404           0 :         void convertInto( std::string const& _source, T& _dest ) {
    4405           0 :             std::stringstream ss;
    4406           0 :             ss << _source;
    4407           0 :             ss >> _dest;
    4408           0 :             if( ss.fail() )
    4409           0 :                 throw std::runtime_error( "Unable to convert " + _source + " to destination type" );
    4410           0 :         }

    4412           1 :             _dest = _source;
    4413           1 :         }
    4414           0 :         char toLowerCh(char c) {
    4415           0 :             return static_cast<char>( std::tolower( c ) );
    4416             :         }
    4417           0 :         inline void convertInto( std::string const& _source, bool& _dest ) {
    4418           0 :             std::string sourceLC = _source;
    4419           0 :             std::transform( sourceLC.begin(), sourceLC.end(), sourceLC.begin(), toLowerCh );

    4422           0 :             else if( sourceLC == "n" || sourceLC == "0" || sourceLC == "false" || sourceLC == "no" || sourceLC == "off" )

    4425           0 :                 throw std::runtime_error( "Expected a boolean value but did not recognise:\n  '" + _source + "'" );
    4426           0 :         }

    4546             :     class Parser {
    4547             :         enum Mode { None, MaybeShortOpt, SlashOpt, ShortOpt, LongOpt, Positional };
    4548             :         Mode mode;
    4549             :         std::size_t from;
    4550             :         bool inQuotes;
    4551             :     public:
    4552             : 
    4553           0 :         struct Token {
    4554             :             enum Type { Positional, ShortOpt, LongOpt };
    4555           0 :             Token( Type _type, std::string const& _data ) : type( _type ), data( _data ) {}
    4556             :             Type type;
    4557             :             std::string data;
    4558             :         };
    4559             : 
    4560           1 :         Parser() : mode( None ), from( 0 ), inQuotes( false ){}
    4561             : 
    4562           1 :         void parseIntoTokens( std::vector<std::string> const& args, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4563           2 :             const std::string doubleDash = "--";
    4564           1 :             for( std::size_t i = 1; i < args.size() && args[i] != doubleDash; ++i )
    4565           0 :                 parseIntoTokens( args[i], tokens);
    4566           1 :         }
    4567             : 
    4568           0 :         void parseIntoTokens( std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4569           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < arg.size(); ++i ) {
    4570           0 :                 char c = arg[i];
    4571           0 :                 if( c == '"' )
    4572           0 :                     inQuotes = !inQuotes;
    4573           0 :                 mode = handleMode( i, c, arg, tokens );
    4574             :             }
    4575           0 :             mode = handleMode( arg.size(), '\0', arg, tokens );
    4576           0 :         }
    4577           0 :         Mode handleMode( std::size_t i, char c, std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4578           0 :             switch( mode ) {
    4579           0 :                 case None: return handleNone( i, c );
    4580           0 :                 case MaybeShortOpt: return handleMaybeShortOpt( i, c );
    4581           0 :                 case ShortOpt:
    4582             :                 case LongOpt:
    4583           0 :                 case SlashOpt: return handleOpt( i, c, arg, tokens );
    4584           0 :                 case Positional: return handlePositional( i, c, arg, tokens );
    4585           0 :                 default: throw std::logic_error( "Unknown mode" );
    4586             :             }
    4587             :         }
    4588             : 
    4589           0 :         Mode handleNone( std::size_t i, char c ) {
    4590           0 :             if( inQuotes ) {
    4591           0 :                 from = i;
    4592           0 :                 return Positional;
    4593             :             }
    4594           0 :             switch( c ) {
    4595           0 :                 case '-': return MaybeShortOpt;
    4596             : #ifdef CLARA_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    4597             :                 case '/': from = i+1; return SlashOpt;
    4598             : #endif
    4599           0 :                 default: from = i; return Positional;
    4600             :             }
    4601             :         }
    4602           0 :         Mode handleMaybeShortOpt( std::size_t i, char c ) {
    4603           0 :             switch( c ) {
    4604           0 :                 case '-': from = i+1; return LongOpt;
    4605           0 :                 default: from = i; return ShortOpt;
    4606             :             }
    4607             :         }
    4608             : 
    4609           0 :         Mode handleOpt( std::size_t i, char c, std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4610           0 :             if( std::string( ":=\0", 3 ).find( c ) == std::string::npos )
    4611           0 :                 return mode;
    4612             : 
    4613           0 :             std::string optName = arg.substr( from, i-from );
    4614           0 :             if( mode == ShortOpt )
    4615           0 :                 for( std::size_t j = 0; j < optName.size(); ++j )
    4616           0 :                     tokens.push_back( Token( Token::ShortOpt, optName.substr( j, 1 ) ) );

    4959           1 :         std::vector<Parser::Token> populateOptions( std::vector<Parser::Token> const& tokens, ConfigT& config ) const {

    4966           0 :                     Arg const& arg = *it;
    4967             :

    4969           0 :                         if( ( token.type == Parser::Token::ShortOpt && arg.hasShortName( token.data ) ) ||

    4975           0 :                                     arg.boundField.set( config, tokens[++i].data );

    4979             :                             }

    5093           0 :         if( startsWith( "declared", order ) )
    5094           0 :             config.runOrder = RunTests::InDeclarationOrder;

    5096           0 :             config.runOrder = RunTests::InLexicographicalOrder;

    5098           0 :             config.runOrder = RunTests::InRandomOrder;
    5099             :         else
    5100           0 :             throw std::runtime_error( "Unrecognised ordering: '" + order + '\'' );
    5101           0 :     }

    5105             :         }
    5106             :         else {

    5140           0 :             config.waitForKeypress = WaitForKeypress::BeforeExit;

    5154             : 
    5155           0 :         std::string line;
    5156           0 :         while( std::getline( f, line ) ) {

    5159           0 :                 if( !startsWith( line, '"' ) )

    5161           0 :                 addTestOrTags( config, line + ',' );
    5162             :             }
    5163             :         }
    5164           0 :     }

    5333             : #else
    5334             :     const unsigned int consoleWidth = 80;
    5335             : #endif
    5336             : 
    5337             :     struct TextAttributes {
    5338           0 :         TextAttributes()
    5339           0 :         :   initialIndent( std::string::npos ),
    5340             :             indent( 0 ),
    5341           0 :             width( consoleWidth-1 )
    5342           0 :         {}
    5343             : 
    5344           0 :         TextAttributes& setInitialIndent( std::size_t _value )  { initialIndent = _value; return *this; }
    5345           0 :         TextAttributes& setIndent( std::size_t _value )         { indent = _value; return *this; }
    5346           0 :         TextAttributes& setWidth( std::size_t _value )          { width = _value; return *this; }
    5347             : 
    5348             :         std::size_t initialIndent;  // indent of first line, or npos
    5349             :         std::size_t indent;         // indent of subsequent lines, or all if initialIndent is npos
    5350             :         std::size_t width;          // maximum width of text, including indent. Longer text will wrap
    5351             :     };
    5352             : 
    5353           0 :     class Text {
    5354             :     public:
    5355           0 :         Text( std::string const& _str, TextAttributes const& _attr = TextAttributes() )
    5356           0 :         : attr( _attr )
    5357             :         {
    5358           0 :             const std::string wrappableBeforeChars = "[({<\t";
    5359           0 :             const std::string wrappableAfterChars = "])}>-,./|\\";
    5360           0 :             const std::string wrappableInsteadOfChars = " \n\r";
    5361           0 :             std::string indent = _attr.initialIndent != std::string::npos
    5362           0 :                 ? std::string( _attr.initialIndent, ' ' )
    5363           0 :                 : std::string( _attr.indent, ' ' );
    5364             : 
    5365             :             typedef std::string::const_iterator iterator;
    5366           0 :             iterator it = _str.begin();
    5367           0 :             const iterator strEnd = _str.end();
    5368             : 
    5369           0 :             while( it != strEnd ) {
    5370             : 
    5371           0 :                 if( lines.size() >= 1000 ) {
    5372           0 :                     lines.push_back( "... message truncated due to excessive size" );
    5373           0 :                     return;
    5374             :                 }
    5375             : 
    5376           0 :                 std::string suffix;
    5377           0 :                 std::size_t width = (std::min)( static_cast<size_t>( strEnd-it ), _attr.width-static_cast<size_t>( indent.size() ) );
    5378           0 :                 iterator itEnd = it+width;
    5379           0 :                 iterator itNext = _str.end();
    5380             : 
    5381           0 :                 iterator itNewLine = std::find( it, itEnd, '\n' );
    5382           0 :                 if( itNewLine != itEnd )
    5383           0 :                     itEnd = itNewLine;
    5384             : 
    5385           0 :                 if( itEnd != strEnd  ) {
    5386           0 :                     bool foundWrapPoint = false;
    5387           0 :                     iterator findIt = itEnd;
    5388           0 :                     do {
    5389           0 :                         if( wrappableAfterChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos && findIt != itEnd ) {
    5390           0 :                             itEnd = findIt+1;
    5391           0 :                             itNext = findIt+1;
    5392           0 :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5393             :                         }
    5394           0 :                         else if( findIt > it && wrappableBeforeChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos ) {
    5395           0 :                             itEnd = findIt;
    5396           0 :                             itNext = findIt;
    5397           0 :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5398             :                         }
    5399           0 :                         else if( wrappableInsteadOfChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos ) {
    5400           0 :                             itNext = findIt+1;
    5401           0 :                             itEnd = findIt;
    5402           0 :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5403             :                         }
    5404           0 :                         if( findIt == it )
    5405           0 :                             break;
    5406             :                         else
    5407           0 :                             --findIt;
    5408             :                     }
    5409           0 :                     while( !foundWrapPoint );
    5410             : 
    5411           0 :                     if( !foundWrapPoint ) {
    5412             :                         // No good wrap char, so we'll break mid word and add a hyphen
    5413           0 :                         --itEnd;
    5414           0 :                         itNext = itEnd;
    5415           0 :                         suffix = "-";
    5416             :                     }
    5417             :                     else {
    5418           0 :                         while( itEnd > it && wrappableInsteadOfChars.find( *(itEnd-1) ) != std::string::npos )
    5419           0 :                             --itEnd;
    5420             :                     }
    5421             :                 }
    5422           0 :                 lines.push_back( indent + std::string( it, itEnd ) + suffix );
    5423             : 
    5424           0 :                 if( indent.size() != _attr.indent )
    5425           0 :                     indent = std::string( _attr.indent, ' ' );
    5426           0 :                 it = itNext;
    5427             :             }
    5428             :         }
    5429             : 
    5430             :         typedef std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator const_iterator;
    5431             : 
    5432           0 :         const_iterator begin() const { return lines.begin(); }
    5433           0 :         const_iterator end() const { return lines.end(); }
    5434             :         std::string const& last() const { return lines.back(); }
    5435             :         std::size_t size() const { return lines.size(); }
    5436             :         std::string const& operator[]( std::size_t _index ) const { return lines[_index]; }
    5437             :         std::string toString() const {
    5438             :             std::ostringstream oss;
    5439             :             oss << *this;
    5440             :             return oss.str();
    5441             :         }
    5442             : 
    5443           0 :         inline friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& _stream, Text const& _text ) {
    5444           0 :             for( Text::const_iterator it = _text.begin(), itEnd = _text.end();
    5445           0 :                 it != itEnd; ++it ) {
    5446           0 :                 if( it != _text.begin() )
    5447           0 :                     _stream << "\n";
    5448           0 :                 _stream << *it;
    5449             :             }
    5450           0 :             return _stream;
    5451             :         }
    5452             : 
    5453             :     private:

    5479             :         enum Code {

    5496             :

    5509             : 
    5510             :             SecondaryText = LightGrey,
    5511             :             Headers = White
    5512             :         };

    5562             :     template<typename T>
    5563           3 :     struct LazyStat : Option<T> {
    5564           3 :         LazyStat() : used( false ) {}
    5565           3 :         LazyStat& operator=( T const& _value ) {
    5566           3 :             Option<T>::operator=( _value );
    5567           3 :             used = false;
    5568           3 :             return *this;
    5569             :         }
    5570           5 :         void reset() {
    5571           5 :             Option<T>::reset();
    5572           5 :             used = false;
    5573           5 :         }
    5574             :         bool used;
    5575             :     };
    5576             :

    5791           0 :     inline std::size_t listTests( Config const& config ) {
    5792             : 
    5793           0 :         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
    5794           0 :         if( config.testSpec().hasFilters() )
    5795           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Matching test cases:\n";
    5796             :         else {
    5797           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available test cases:\n";
    5798           0 :             testSpec = TestSpecParser( ITagAliasRegistry::get() ).parse( "*" ).testSpec();
    5799             :         }
    5800             : 
    5801           0 :         std::size_t matchedTests = 0;
    5802           0 :         TextAttributes nameAttr, descAttr, tagsAttr;
    5803           0 :         nameAttr.setInitialIndent( 2 ).setIndent( 4 );
    5804           0 :         descAttr.setIndent( 4 );
    5805           0 :         tagsAttr.setIndent( 6 );
    5806             : 
    5807           0 :         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );
    5808           0 :         for( std::vector<TestCase>::const_iterator it = matchedTestCases.begin(), itEnd = matchedTestCases.end();
    5809           0 :                 it != itEnd;
    5810             :                 ++it ) {
    5811           0 :             matchedTests++;
    5812           0 :             TestCaseInfo const& testCaseInfo = it->getTestCaseInfo();
    5813           0 :             Colour::Code colour = testCaseInfo.isHidden()
    5814           0 :                 ? Colour::SecondaryText
    5815           0 :                 : Colour::None;
    5816           0 :             Colour colourGuard( colour );
    5817             : 
    5818           0 :             Catch::cout() << Text( testCaseInfo.name, nameAttr ) << std::endl;
    5819           0 :             if( config.listExtraInfo() ) {
    5820           0 :                 Catch::cout() << "    " << testCaseInfo.lineInfo << std::endl;
    5821           0 :                 std::string description = testCaseInfo.description;
    5822           0 :                 if( description.empty() )
    5823           0 :                     description = "(NO DESCRIPTION)";
    5824           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Text( description, descAttr ) << std::endl;
    5825             :             }
    5826           0 :             if( !testCaseInfo.tags.empty() )
    5827           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Text( testCaseInfo.tagsAsString, tagsAttr ) << std::endl;
    5828             :         }
    5829             : 
    5830           0 :         if( !config.testSpec().hasFilters() )
    5831           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTests, "test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
    5832             :         else
    5833           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTests, "matching test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
    5834           0 :         return matchedTests;
    5835             :     }
    5836             :

    5877           0 :     inline std::size_t listTags( Config const& config ) {

    5880           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Tags for matching test cases:\n";
