    5886           0 :         std::map<std::string, TagInfo> tagCounts;

    5888           0 :         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );

    5900           0 :                     countIt = tagCounts.insert( std::make_pair( lcaseTagName, TagInfo() ) ).first;
    5901           0 :                 countIt->second.add( tagName );
    5902             :             }
    5903             :         }
    5904             :

    5921           0 :     inline std::size_t listReporters( Config const& /*config*/ ) {

    5944           1 :     inline Option<std::size_t> list( Config const& config ) {
    5945           1 :         Option<std::size_t> listedCount;
    5946           1 :         if( config.listTests() || ( config.listExtraInfo() && !config.listTestNamesOnly() ) )
    5947           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTests( config );

    5951           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTags( config );

    5953           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listReporters( config );

    6044             :         }
    6045             :

    6048           3 :             m_runState = Executing;
    6049           3 :         }
    6050           6 :         void completeCycle() {
    6051           6 :             m_runState = CompletedCycle;

    6053             :

    6370             : namespace Catch {
    6371             : 
    6372             :     struct SignalDefs { DWORD id; const char* name; };
    6373             :     extern SignalDefs signalDefs[];
    6374             :     // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
    6375             :     // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
    6376             :     // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
    6377             :     SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    6378             :         { EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    6379             :         { EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW, "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow" },
    6380             :         { EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    6381             :         { EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO, "Divide by zero error" },
    6382             :     };
    6383             : 
    6384             :     struct FatalConditionHandler {
    6385             : 
    6386             :         static LONG CALLBACK handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
    6387             :             for (int i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    6388             :                 if (ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == signalDefs[i].id) {
    6389             :                     reportFatal(signalDefs[i].name);
    6390             :                 }
    6391             :             }
    6392             :             // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
    6393             :             // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
    6394             :             return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
    6395             :         }
    6396             : 
    6397             :         FatalConditionHandler() {
    6398             :             isSet = true;
    6399             :             // 32k seems enough for Catch to handle stack overflow,
    6400             :             // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
    6401             :             guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
    6402             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = CATCH_NULL;
    6403             :             // Register as first handler in current chain
    6404             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
    6405             :             // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
    6406             :             SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    6407             :         }
    6408             : 
    6409             :         static void reset() {
    6410             :             if (isSet) {
    6411             :                 // Unregister handler and restore the old guarantee
    6412             :                 RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle);
    6413             :                 SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    6414             :                 exceptionHandlerHandle = CATCH_NULL;
    6415             :                 isSet = false;
    6416             :             }
    6417             :         }
    6418             : 
    6419             :         ~FatalConditionHandler() {
    6420             :             reset();
    6421             :         }
    6422             :     private:
    6423             :         static bool isSet;
    6424             :         static ULONG guaranteeSize;
    6425             :         static PVOID exceptionHandlerHandle;
    6426             :     };
    6427             : 
    6428             :     bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;

    6451             : 
    6452             :     struct SignalDefs {
    6453             :         int id;
    6454             :         const char* name;
    6455             :     };
    6456             :     extern SignalDefs signalDefs[];
    6457             :     SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    6458             :             { SIGINT,  "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal" },
    6459             :             { SIGILL,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    6460             :             { SIGFPE,  "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal" },
    6461             :             { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    6462             :             { SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal" },
    6463             :             { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal" }
    6464             :     };
    6465             : 
    6466             :     struct FatalConditionHandler {
    6467             : 
    6468             :         static bool isSet;
    6469             :         static struct sigaction oldSigActions [sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs)];
    6470             :         static stack_t oldSigStack;
    6471             :         static char altStackMem[SIGSTKSZ];
    6472             : 
    6473           0 :         static void handleSignal( int sig ) {
    6474           0 :             std::string name = "<unknown signal>";
    6475           0 :             for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    6476           0 :                 SignalDefs &def = signalDefs[i];
    6477           0 :                 if (sig == def.id) {
    6478           0 :                     name = def.name;
    6479           0 :                     break;
    6480             :                 }
    6481             :             }
    6482           0 :             reset();
    6483           0 :             reportFatal(name);
    6484           0 :             raise( sig );
    6485           0 :         }
    6486             : 
    6487           3 :         FatalConditionHandler() {
    6488           3 :             isSet = true;
    6489             :             stack_t sigStack;
    6490           3 :             sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
    6491           3 :             sigStack.ss_size = SIGSTKSZ;
    6492           3 :             sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
    6493           3 :             sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
    6494           3 :             struct sigaction sa = { 0 };
    6495             : 
    6496           3 :             sa.sa_handler = handleSignal;
    6497           3 :             sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
    6498          21 :             for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    6499          18 :                 sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
    6500             :             }
    6501           3 :         }
    6502             : 
    6503           3 :         ~FatalConditionHandler() {
    6504           3 :             reset();
    6505           3 :         }
    6506           6 :         static void reset() {
    6507           6 :             if( isSet ) {
    6508             :                 // Set signals back to previous values -- hopefully nobody overwrote them in the meantime
    6509          21 :                 for( std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i ) {
    6510          18 :                     sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], CATCH_NULL);
    6511             :                 }
    6512             :                 // Return the old stack
    6513           3 :                 sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, CATCH_NULL);
    6514           3 :                 isSet = false;
    6515             :             }
    6516           6 :         }
    6517             :     };

    6557             : 
    6558             :     // StdErr has two constituent streams in C++, std::cerr and std::clog
    6559             :     // This means that we need to redirect 2 streams into 1 to keep proper
    6560             :     // order of writes and cannot use StreamRedirect on its own
    6561             :     class StdErrRedirect {
    6562             :     public:
    6563           0 :         StdErrRedirect(std::string& targetString)
    6564           0 :         :m_cerrBuf( cerr().rdbuf() ), m_clogBuf(clog().rdbuf()),
    6565           0 :         m_targetString(targetString){
    6566           0 :             cerr().rdbuf(m_oss.rdbuf());
    6567           0 :             clog().rdbuf(m_oss.rdbuf());
    6568           0 :         }
    6569           0 :         ~StdErrRedirect() {
    6570           0 :             m_targetString += m_oss.str();
    6571           0 :             cerr().rdbuf(m_cerrBuf);
    6572           0 :             clog().rdbuf(m_clogBuf);
    6573           0 :         }
    6574             :     private:
    6575             :         std::streambuf* m_cerrBuf;
    6576             :         std::streambuf* m_clogBuf;
    6577             :         std::ostringstream m_oss;
    6578             :         std::string& m_targetString;
    6579             :     };

    6581             :     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    6582             : 
    6583             :     class RunContext : public IResultCapture, public IRunner {
    6584             : 
    6585             :         RunContext( RunContext const& );
    6586             :         void operator =( RunContext const& );
    6587             : 
    6588             :     public:
    6589             : 
    6590           1 :         explicit RunContext( Ptr<IConfig const> const& _config, Ptr<IStreamingReporter> const& reporter )
    6591           3 :         :   m_runInfo( _config->name() ),
    6592           1 :             m_context( getCurrentMutableContext() ),
    6593             :             m_activeTestCase( CATCH_NULL ),
    6594             :             m_config( _config ),
    6595             :             m_reporter( reporter ),
    6596           3 :             m_shouldReportUnexpected ( true )
    6597             :         {

    7352           1 :     inline std::string extractClassName( std::string const& classOrQualifiedMethodName ) {
    7353           1 :         std::string className = classOrQualifiedMethodName;
    7354           1 :         if( startsWith( className, '&' ) )
    7355             :         {
    7356           0 :             std::size_t lastColons = className.rfind( "::" );
    7357           0 :             std::size_t penultimateColons = className.rfind( "::", lastColons-1 );

    7359           0 :                 penultimateColons = 1;
    7360           0 :             className = className.substr( penultimateColons, lastColons-penultimateColons );
    7361             :         }
    7362           1 :         return className;
    7363             :     }

    7640           0 :             sync();
    7641           0 :         }

    7644           0 :         int overflow( int c ) {
    7645           0 :             sync();

    7648           0 :                 if( pbase() == epptr() )
    7649           0 :                     m_writer( std::string( 1, static_cast<char>( c ) ) );
    7650             :                 else
    7651           0 :                     sputc( static_cast<char>( c ) );
    7652             :             }
    7653           0 :             return 0;
    7654             :         }
    7655             : 
    7656           0 :         int sync() {
    7657           0 :             if( pbase() != pptr() ) {
    7658           0 :                 m_writer( std::string( pbase(), static_cast<std::string::size_type>( pptr() - pbase() ) ) );
    7659           0 :                 setp( pbase(), epptr() );
    7660             :             }
    7661           0 :             return 0;
    7662             :         }
    7663             :     };

    7866             :     public:
    7867             :         Win32ColourImpl() : stdoutHandle( GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE) )
    7868             :         {
    7869             :             CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbiInfo;
    7870             :             GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo( stdoutHandle, &csbiInfo );
    7871             :             originalForegroundAttributes = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~( BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED | BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY );
    7872             :             originalBackgroundAttributes = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~( FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY );
    7873             :         }
    7874             : 
    7875             :         virtual void use( Colour::Code _colourCode ) {
    7876             :             switch( _colourCode ) {
    7877             :                 case Colour::None:      return setTextAttribute( originalForegroundAttributes );
    7878             :                 case Colour::White:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    7879             :                 case Colour::Red:       return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_RED );
    7880             :                 case Colour::Green:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7881             :                 case Colour::Blue:      return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    7882             :                 case Colour::Cyan:      return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7883             :                 case Colour::Yellow:    return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7884             :                 case Colour::Grey:      return setTextAttribute( 0 );
    7885             : 
    7886             :                 case Colour::LightGrey:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY );
    7887             :                 case Colour::BrightRed:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_RED );
    7888             :                 case Colour::BrightGreen:   return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7889             :                 case Colour::BrightWhite:   return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    7890             : 
    7891             :                 case Colour::Bright: throw std::logic_error( "not a colour" );
    7892             :             }
    7893             :         }
    7894             : 
    7895             :     private:
    7896             :         void setTextAttribute( WORD _textAttribute ) {
    7897             :             SetConsoleTextAttribute( stdoutHandle, _textAttribute | originalBackgroundAttributes );
    7898             :         }
    7899             :         HANDLE stdoutHandle;
    7900             :         WORD originalForegroundAttributes;
    7901             :         WORD originalBackgroundAttributes;

    8186           0 :     inline TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties parseSpecialTag( std::string const& tag ) {
    8187           0 :         if( startsWith( tag, '.' ) ||
    8188           0 :             tag == "hide" ||
    8189           0 :             tag == "!hide" )
    8190           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::IsHidden;
    8191           0 :         else if( tag == "!throws" )
    8192           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::Throws;
    8193           0 :         else if( tag == "!shouldfail" )
    8194           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::ShouldFail;
    8195           0 :         else if( tag == "!mayfail" )
    8196           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::MayFail;
    8197           0 :         else if( tag == "!nonportable" )
    8198           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::NonPortable;
    8199             :         else
    8200           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::None;
    8201             :     }
    8202           0 :     inline bool isReservedTag( std::string const& tag ) {
    8203           0 :         return parseSpecialTag( tag ) == TestCaseInfo::None && tag.size() > 0 && !std::isalnum( tag[0] );
    8204             :     }
    8205           0 :     inline void enforceNotReservedTag( std::string const& tag, SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo ) {

    8215           0 :     }

    8579             : namespace Catch {
    8580             : 
    8581             :     namespace {
    8582             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    8583             :         UInt64 getCurrentTicks() {
    8584             :             static UInt64 hz=0, hzo=0;
    8585             :             if (!hz) {
    8586             :                 QueryPerformanceFrequency( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &hz ) );
    8587             :                 QueryPerformanceCounter( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &hzo ) );
    8588             :             }
    8589             :             UInt64 t;
    8590             :             QueryPerformanceCounter( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &t ) );
    8591             :             return ((t-hzo)*1000000)/hz;
    8592             :         }
    8593             : #else
    8594          18 :         UInt64 getCurrentTicks() {
    8595             :             timeval t;
    8596          18 :             gettimeofday(&t,CATCH_NULL);
    8597          18 :             return static_cast<UInt64>( t.tv_sec ) * 1000000ull + static_cast<UInt64>( t.tv_usec );
    8598             :         }
    8599             : #endif
    8600             :     }
    8601             : 
    8602          12 :     void Timer::start() {
    8603          12 :         m_ticks = getCurrentTicks();
    8604          12 :     }
    8605           6 :     unsigned int Timer::getElapsedMicroseconds() const {
    8606           6 :         return static_cast<unsigned int>(getCurrentTicks() - m_ticks);
    8607             :     }
    8608           0 :     unsigned int Timer::getElapsedMilliseconds() const {
    8609           0 :         return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000);
    8610             :     }
    8611           6 :     double Timer::getElapsedSeconds() const {
    8612           6 :         return getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000000.0;
    8613             :     }
    8614             : 
    8615             : } // namespace Catch
    8616             : 
    8617             : #ifdef __clang__
    8618             : #pragma clang diagnostic pop
    8619             : #endif

    8622             :

    8624             : #include <cctype>
    8625             : 
    8626             : namespace Catch {
    8627             : 
    8628           2 :     bool startsWith( std::string const& s, std::string const& prefix ) {
    8629           2 :         return s.size() >= prefix.size() && std::equal(prefix.begin(), prefix.end(), s.begin());
    8630             :     }
    8631           1 :     bool startsWith( std::string const& s, char prefix ) {
    8632           1 :         return !s.empty() && s[0] == prefix;
    8633             :     }
    8634           0 :     bool endsWith( std::string const& s, std::string const& suffix ) {
    8635           0 :         return s.size() >= suffix.size() && std::equal(suffix.rbegin(), suffix.rend(), s.rbegin());
    8636             :     }

    8638           0 :         return !s.empty() && s[s.size()-1] == suffix;

    8659           0 :         return start != std::string::npos ? str.substr( start, 1+end-start ) : std::string();

    8773             : // #included from: catch_debugger.hpp
    8774             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_DEBUGGER_HPP_INCLUDED
    8775             : 
    8776             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    8777             : 
    8778             :     #include <assert.h>
    8779             :     #include <stdbool.h>
    8780             :     #include <sys/types.h>
    8781             :     #include <unistd.h>
    8782             :     #include <sys/sysctl.h>
    8783             : 
    8784             :     namespace Catch{
    8785             : 
    8786             :         // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
    8787             :         // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
    8788             : 
    8789             :         // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
    8790             :         // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
    8791             :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    8792             : 
    8793             :             int                 mib[4];
    8794             :             struct kinfo_proc   info;
    8795             :             size_t              size;
    8796             : 
    8797             :             // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
    8798             :             // reason, we get a predictable result.
    8799             : 
    8800             :             info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
    8801             : 
    8802             :             // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
    8803             :             // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
    8804             : 
    8805             :             mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
    8806             :             mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
    8807             :             mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
    8808             :             mib[3] = getpid();
    8809             : 
    8810             :             // Call sysctl.
    8811             : 
    8812             :             size = sizeof(info);
    8813             :             if( sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &size, CATCH_NULL, 0) != 0 ) {
    8814             :                 Catch::cerr() << "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n" << std::endl;
    8815             :                 return false;
    8816             :             }
    8817             : 
    8818             :             // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
    8819             : 
    8820             :             return ( (info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0 );
    8821             :         }
    8822             :     } // namespace Catch
    8823             : 
    8824             : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX)
    8825             :     #include <fstream>
    8826             :     #include <string>
    8827             : 
    8828             :     namespace Catch{
    8829             :         // The standard POSIX way of detecting a debugger is to attempt to
    8830             :         // ptrace() the process, but this needs to be done from a child and not
    8831             :         // this process itself to still allow attaching to this process later
    8832             :         // if wanted, so is rather heavy. Under Linux we have the PID of the
    8833             :         // "debugger" (which doesn't need to be gdb, of course, it could also
    8834             :         // be strace, for example) in /proc/$PID/status, so just get it from
    8835             :         // there instead.
    8836           1 :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    8837             :             // Libstdc++ has a bug, where std::ifstream sets errno to 0
    8838             :             // This way our users can properly assert over errno values
    8839           2 :             ErrnoGuard guard;
    8840           2 :             std::ifstream in("/proc/self/status");
    8841           8 :             for( std::string line; std::getline(in, line); ) {
    8842             :                 static const int PREFIX_LEN = 11;
    8843           8 :                 if( line.compare(0, PREFIX_LEN, "TracerPid:\t") == 0 ) {
    8844             :                     // We're traced if the PID is not 0 and no other PID starts
    8845             :                     // with 0 digit, so it's enough to check for just a single
    8846             :                     // character.
    8847           1 :                     return line.length() > PREFIX_LEN && line[PREFIX_LEN] != '0';
    8848             :                 }
    8849             :             }
    8850             : 
    8851           0 :             return false;
    8852             :         }
    8853             :     } // namespace Catch
    8854             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    8855             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    8856             :     namespace Catch {
    8857             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    8858             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    8859             :         }
    8860             :     }
    8861             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    8862             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    8863             :     namespace Catch {
    8864             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    8865             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    8866             :         }
    8867             :     }
    8868             : #else
    8869             :     namespace Catch {
    8870             :        inline bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
    8871             :     }
    8872             : #endif // Platform
    8873             : 
    8874             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    8875             :

    8900             :         const int hexThreshold = 255;
    8901             : 
    8902             :         struct Endianness {
    8903             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
    8904             : 
    8905           0 :             static Arch which() {
    8906             :                 union _{
    8907             :                     int asInt;
    8908             :                     char asChar[sizeof (int)];
    8909             :                 } u;
    8910             : 
    8911           0 :                 u.asInt = 1;
    8912           0 :                 return ( u.asChar[sizeof(int)-1] == 1 ) ? Big : Little;
    8913             :             }
    8914             :         };
    8915             :     }
    8916             : 
    8917           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size )
    8918             :     {
    8919             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
    8920           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
    8921           0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
    8922           0 :             i = end-1;
    8923           0 :             end = inc = -1;
    8924             :         }
    8925             : 
    8926           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
    8927           0 :         std::ostringstream os;
    8928           0 :         os << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
    8929           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
    8930           0 :              os << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
    8931           0 :        return os.str();
    8932             :     }
    8933             : }

    9195             : 
    9196           3 :     void ResultBuilder::react() {
    9197             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_FAST_COMPILE)

    9199             :             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    9200             :             // To inspect the state during test, you need to go one level up the callstack
    9201             :             // To go back to the test and change execution, jump over the throw statement
    9202             :             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

    9204             :         }

    9215           0 :         return build( *this );

    9217             : 
    9218             :     // CAVEAT: The returned AssertionResult stores a pointer to the argument expr,
    9219             :     //         a temporary DecomposedExpression, which in turn holds references to
    9220             :     //         operands, possibly temporary as well.
    9221             :     //         It should immediately be passed to handleResult; if the expression
    9222             :     //         needs to be reported, its string expansion must be composed before
    9223             :     //         the temporaries are destroyed.

    9541             :     namespace {
    9542             :         // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is required
    9543             :         // Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance is... not good.
    9544           0 :         std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
    9545             :             // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
    9546             :             // + 1 for decimal point
    9547             :             // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
    9548             :             // + 1 for null terminator
    9549           0 :             const size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
    9550             :             char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
    9551             : 
    9552             :             // Save previous errno, to prevent sprintf from overwriting it
    9553           0 :             ErrnoGuard guard;
    9554             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    9555             :             sprintf_s(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
    9556             : #else
    9557           0 :             sprintf(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
    9558             : #endif
    9559           0 :             return std::string(buffer);
    9560             :         }
    9561             :     }
    9562             :

    9600           1 :         virtual void testGroupEnded( TestGroupStats const& /* _testGroupStats */ ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9601           1 :             currentGroupInfo.reset();
    9602           1 :         }

    9608             :

    9611             :             // It can optionally be overridden in the derived class.

    9613             :

    9641             :             }

    9643             :                 return operator==( *other );

    9688           0 :         virtual void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9689           0 :             SectionStats incompleteStats( sectionInfo, Counts(), 0, false );
    9690           0 :             Ptr<SectionNode> node;

    9692           0 :                 if( !m_rootSection )
    9693           0 :                     m_rootSection = new SectionNode( incompleteStats );
    9694           0 :                 node = m_rootSection;
    9695             :             }
    9696             :             else {
    9697           0 :                 SectionNode& parentNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9698             :                 SectionNode::ChildSections::const_iterator it =
    9699           0 :                     std::find_if(   parentNode.childSections.begin(),
    9700             :                                     parentNode.childSections.end(),
    9701           0 :                                     BySectionInfo( sectionInfo ) );
    9702           0 :                 if( it == parentNode.childSections.end() ) {
    9703           0 :                     node = new SectionNode( incompleteStats );
    9704           0 :                     parentNode.childSections.push_back( node );
    9705             :                 }
    9706             :                 else
    9707           0 :                     node = *it;
    9708             :             }
    9709           0 :             m_sectionStack.push_back( node );
    9710           0 :             m_deepestSection = node;
    9711           0 :         }
    9712             : 
    9713           0 :         virtual void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {}
    9714             : 
    9715           0 :         virtual bool assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9716           0 :             assert( !m_sectionStack.empty() );
    9717           0 :             SectionNode& sectionNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9718           0 :             sectionNode.assertions.push_back( assertionStats );
    9719             :             // AssertionResult holds a pointer to a temporary DecomposedExpression,
    9720             :             // which getExpandedExpression() calls to build the expression string.
    9721             :             // Our section stack copy of the assertionResult will likely outlive the
    9722             :             // temporary, so it must be expanded or discarded now to avoid calling
    9723             :             // a destroyed object later.
    9724           0 :             prepareExpandedExpression( sectionNode.assertions.back().assertionResult );
    9725           0 :             return true;
    9726             :         }
    9727           0 :         virtual void sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9728           0 :             assert( !m_sectionStack.empty() );
    9729           0 :             SectionNode& node = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9730           0 :             node.stats = sectionStats;
    9731           0 :             m_sectionStack.pop_back();
    9732           0 :         }
    9733           0 :         virtual void testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9734           0 :             Ptr<TestCaseNode> node = new TestCaseNode( testCaseStats );
    9735           0 :             assert( m_sectionStack.size() == 0 );
    9736           0 :             node->children.push_back( m_rootSection );
    9737           0 :             m_testCases.push_back( node );
    9738           0 :             m_rootSection.reset();
    9739             : 
    9740           0 :             assert( m_deepestSection );
    9741           0 :             m_deepestSection->stdOut = testCaseStats.stdOut;
    9742           0 :             m_deepestSection->stdErr = testCaseStats.stdErr;
    9743           0 :         }
    9744           0 :         virtual void testGroupEnded( TestGroupStats const& testGroupStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9745           0 :             Ptr<TestGroupNode> node = new TestGroupNode( testGroupStats );
    9746           0 :             node->children.swap( m_testCases );
    9747           0 :             m_testGroups.push_back( node );
    9748           0 :         }
    9749           0 :         virtual void testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& testRunStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9750           0 :             Ptr<TestRunNode> node = new TestRunNode( testRunStats );
    9751           0 :             node->children.swap( m_testGroups );
    9752           0 :             m_testRuns.push_back( node );
    9753           0 :             testRunEndedCumulative();
    9754           0 :         }
    9755             :         virtual void testRunEndedCumulative() = 0;
    9756             : 
    9757           0 :         virtual void skipTest( TestCaseInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {}
    9758             : 
    9759           0 :         virtual void prepareExpandedExpression( AssertionResult& result ) const {
    9760           0 :             if( result.isOk() )
    9761           0 :                 result.discardDecomposedExpression();
    9762             :             else
    9763           0 :                 result.expandDecomposedExpression();
    9764           0 :         }
    9765             :

    9783           0 :     char const* getLineOfChars() {

    9810             :     template<typename T>
    9811             :     class LegacyReporterRegistrar {
    9812             : 
    9813             :         class ReporterFactory : public IReporterFactory {
    9814             :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {
    9815             :                 return new LegacyReporterAdapter( new T( config ) );
    9816             :             }

    9819             :                 return T::getDescription();
    9820             :             }
    9821             :         };
    9822             : 
    9823             :     public:
    9824             : 
    9825             :         LegacyReporterRegistrar( std::string const& name ) {
    9826             :             getMutableRegistryHub().registerReporter( name, new ReporterFactory() );
    9827             :         }

    9829             : 
    9830             :     template<typename T>
    9831             :     class ReporterRegistrar {
    9832             : 
    9833          12 :         class ReporterFactory : public SharedImpl<IReporterFactory> {
    9834             : 
    9835             :             // *** Please Note ***:
    9836             :             // - If you end up here looking at a compiler error because it's trying to register
    9837             :             // your custom reporter class be aware that the native reporter interface has changed
    9838             :             // to IStreamingReporter. The "legacy" interface, IReporter, is still supported via
    9839             :             // an adapter. Just use REGISTER_LEGACY_REPORTER to take advantage of the adapter.
    9840             :             // However please consider updating to the new interface as the old one is now
    9841             :             // deprecated and will probably be removed quite soon!
    9842             :             // Please contact me via github if you have any questions at all about this.
    9843             :             // In fact, ideally, please contact me anyway to let me know you've hit this - as I have
    9844             :             // no idea who is actually using custom reporters at all (possibly no-one!).
    9845             :             // The new interface is designed to minimise exposure to interface changes in the future.
    9846           1 :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {
    9847           1 :                 return new T( config );
    9848             :             }
    9849             : 
    9850           0 :             virtual std::string getDescription() const {
    9851           0 :                 return T::getDescription();
    9852             :             }
    9853             :         };
    9854             : 
    9855             :     public:
    9856             : 
    9857           4 :         ReporterRegistrar( std::string const& name ) {
    9858           4 :             getMutableRegistryHub().registerReporter( name, new ReporterFactory() );
    9859           4 :         }
    9860             :     };
    9861             : 
    9862             :     template<typename T>
    9863             :     class ListenerRegistrar {
    9864             :

    9866             : 
    9867             :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {
    9868             :                 return new T( config );
    9869             :             }
    9870             :             virtual std::string getDescription() const {
    9871             :                 return std::string();
    9872             :             }
    9873             :         };
    9874             : 
    9875             :     public:
    9876             : 
    9877             :         ListenerRegistrar() {

    9879             :         }
    9880             :     };
    9881             : }

    9906           0 :     class XmlEncode {
    9907             :     public:
    9908             :         enum ForWhat { ForTextNodes, ForAttributes };
    9909             : 
    9910           0 :         XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat = ForTextNodes )
    9911           0 :         :   m_str( str ),
    9912           0 :             m_forWhat( forWhat )
    9913           0 :         {}
    9914             : 
    9915           0 :         void encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
    9916             : 
    9917             :             // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
    9918             :             // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
    9919             : 
    9920           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < m_str.size(); ++ i ) {
    9921           0 :                 char c = m_str[i];
    9922           0 :                 switch( c ) {
    9923           0 :                     case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
    9924           0 :                     case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
    9925             : 
    9926           0 :                     case '>':
    9927             :                         // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
    9928           0 :                         if( i > 2 && m_str[i-1] == ']' && m_str[i-2] == ']' )
    9929           0 :                             os << "&gt;";
    9930             :                         else
    9931           0 :                             os << c;
    9932           0 :                         break;
    9933             : 
    9934           0 :                     case '\"':
    9935           0 :                         if( m_forWhat == ForAttributes )
    9936           0 :                             os << "&quot;";
    9937             :                         else
    9938           0 :                             os << c;
    9939           0 :                         break;
    9940             : 
    9941           0 :                     default:
    9942             :                         // Escape control chars - based on contribution by @espenalb in PR #465 and
    9943             :                         // by @mrpi PR #588
    9944           0 :                         if ( ( c >= 0 && c < '\x09' ) || ( c > '\x0D' && c < '\x20') || c=='\x7F' ) {
    9945             :                             // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
    9946           0 :                             os << "\\x" << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
    9947           0 :                                << static_cast<int>( c );
    9948             :                         }
    9949             :                         else
    9950           0 :                             os << c;
    9951             :                 }
    9952             :             }
    9953           0 :         }
    9954             : 
    9955           0 :         friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
    9956           0 :             xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
    9957           0 :             return os;
    9958             :         }
    9959             : 
    9960             :     private:
    9961             :         std::string m_str;
    9962             :         ForWhat m_forWhat;
    9963             :     };
    9964             : 
    9965             :     class XmlWriter {
    9966             :     public:
    9967             : 
    9968             :         class ScopedElement {
    9969             :         public:

    9977             :             }
    9978             : 
    9979           0 :             ~ScopedElement() {
    9980           0 :                 if( m_writer )
    9981           0 :                     m_writer->endElement();
    9982           0 :             }
    9983             :

   10015           0 :         ~XmlWriter() {
   10016           0 :             while( !m_tags.empty() )
   10017           0 :                 endElement();
   10018           0 :         }
   10019             : 
   10020           0 :         XmlWriter& startElement( std::string const& name ) {
   10021           0 :             ensureTagClosed();
   10022           0 :             newlineIfNecessary();
   10023           0 :             m_os << m_indent << '<' << name;
   10024           0 :             m_tags.push_back( name );
   10025           0 :             m_indent += "  ";
   10026           0 :             m_tagIsOpen = true;
   10027           0 :             return *this;
   10028             :         }
   10029             : 
   10030           0 :         ScopedElement scopedElement( std::string const& name ) {
   10031           0 :             ScopedElement scoped( this );
   10032           0 :             startElement( name );
   10033           0 :             return scoped;
   10034             :         }
   10035             : 
   10036           0 :         XmlWriter& endElement() {
   10037           0 :             newlineIfNecessary();
   10038           0 :             m_indent = m_indent.substr( 0, m_indent.size()-2 );
   10039           0 :             if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
   10040           0 :                 m_os << "/>";
   10041           0 :                 m_tagIsOpen = false;
   10042             :             }
   10043             :             else {
   10044           0 :                 m_os << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
   10045             :             }
   10046           0 :             m_os << std::endl;
   10047           0 :             m_tags.pop_back();
   10048           0 :             return *this;
   10049             :         }
   10050             : 
   10051           0 :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, std::string const& attribute ) {
   10052           0 :             if( !name.empty() && !attribute.empty() )
   10053           0 :                 m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
   10054           0 :             return *this;
   10055             :         }
   10056             : 
   10057           0 :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, bool attribute ) {
   10058           0 :             m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << ( attribute ? "true" : "false" ) << '"';
   10059           0 :             return *this;
   10060             :         }
   10061             : 
   10062             :         template<typename T>
   10063           0 :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, T const& attribute ) {
   10064           0 :             std::ostringstream oss;
   10065           0 :             oss << attribute;
   10066           0 :             return writeAttribute( name, oss.str() );
   10067             :         }
   10068             : 
   10069           0 :         XmlWriter& writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent = true ) {
   10070           0 :             if( !text.empty() ){
   10071           0 :                 bool tagWasOpen = m_tagIsOpen;
   10072           0 :                 ensureTagClosed();
   10073           0 :                 if( tagWasOpen && indent )
   10074           0 :                     m_os << m_indent;
   10075           0 :                 m_os << XmlEncode( text );
   10076           0 :                 m_needsNewline = true;
   10077             :             }
   10078           0 :             return *this;
   10079             :         }
   10080             : 
   10081             :         XmlWriter& writeComment( std::string const& text ) {
   10082             :             ensureTagClosed();
   10083             :             m_os << m_indent << "<!--" << text << "-->";
   10084             :             m_needsNewline = true;
   10085             :             return *this;
   10086             :         }
   10087             : 
   10088           0 :         void writeStylesheetRef( std::string const& url ) {
   10089           0 :             m_os << "<?xml-stylesheet type=\"text/xsl\" href=\"" << url << "\"?>\n";
   10090           0 :         }
   10091             : 
   10092             :         XmlWriter& writeBlankLine() {
   10093             :             ensureTagClosed();
   10094             :             m_os << '\n';
   10095             :             return *this;
   10096             :         }
   10097             : 
   10098           0 :         void ensureTagClosed() {
   10099           0 :             if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
   10100           0 :                 m_os << ">" << std::endl;
   10101           0 :                 m_tagIsOpen = false;
   10102             :             }
   10103           0 :         }
   10104             : 
   10105             :     private:
   10106             :         XmlWriter( XmlWriter const& );

   10108             : 
   10109           0 :         void writeDeclaration() {
   10110           0 :             m_os << "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n";
   10111           0 :         }
   10112             : 
   10113           0 :         void newlineIfNecessary() {
   10114           0 :             if( m_needsNewline ) {
   10115           0 :                 m_os << std::endl;
   10116           0 :                 m_needsNewline = false;
   10117             :             }
   10118           0 :         }
   10119             :

   10129             : namespace Catch {
   10130             :     class XmlReporter : public StreamingReporterBase {

   10134             :             m_xml(_config.stream()),

   10522           0 :         void writeAssertion( AssertionStats const& stats ) {
   10523           0 :             AssertionResult const& result = stats.assertionResult;
   10524           0 :             if( !result.isOk() ) {
   10525           0 :                 std::string elementName;

   10527           0 :                     case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   10528             :                     case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   10529           0 :                         elementName = "error";
   10530           0 :                         break;
   10531           0 :                     case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   10532           0 :                         elementName = "failure";
   10533           0 :                         break;
   10534           0 :                     case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   10535           0 :                         elementName = "failure";
   10536           0 :                         break;
   10537           0 :                     case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   10538           0 :                         elementName = "failure";
   10539           0 :                         break;
   10540             : 
   10541             :                     // We should never see these here:
   10542           0 :                     case ResultWas::Info:
   10543             :                     case ResultWas::Warning:
   10544             :                     case ResultWas::Ok:
   10545             :                     case ResultWas::Unknown:
   10546             :                     case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   10547             :                     case ResultWas::Exception:
   10548           0 :                         elementName = "internalError";
   10549           0 :                         break;

   10551             : 
   10552           0 :                 XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( elementName );
   10553             :

   10555           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );
   10556             : 
   10557           0 :                 std::ostringstream oss;
   10558           0 :                 if( !result.getMessage().empty() )
   10559           0 :                     oss << result.getMessage() << '\n';
   10560           0 :                 for( std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator
   10561           0 :                         it = stats.infoMessages.begin(),
   10562           0 :                         itEnd = stats.infoMessages.end();
   10563           0 :                             it != itEnd;
   10564             :                             ++it )
   10565           0 :                     if( it->type == ResultWas::Info )
   10566           0 :                         oss << it->message << '\n';
   10567             :

   10673           0 :         class AssertionPrinter {

   10694           0 :                         break;

   10699             :                         }

   10701           0 :                             colour = Colour::Error;
   10702           0 :                             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   10703             :                         }

   10707           0 :                             messageLabel = "with messages";
   10708           0 :                         break;

   10722           0 :                         break;

   10727           0 :                         break;

   10901           0 :             SummaryColumn addRow( std::size_t count ) {

   10909           0 :                         row = ' ' + row;

   10921           1 :         void printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {
   10922           1 :             if( totals.testCases.total() == 0 ) {
   10923           0 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << "No tests ran\n";
   10924             :             }
   10925           1 :             else if( totals.assertions.total() > 0 && totals.testCases.allPassed() ) {

   10927           1 :                 stream << " ("
   10928           2 :                         << pluralise( totals.assertions.passed, "assertion" ) << " in "
   10929           2 :                         << pluralise( totals.testCases.passed, "test case" ) << ')'
   10930           1 :                         << '\n';
   10931             :             }
   10932             :             else {
   10933             : 
   10934           0 :                 std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;

   10939           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.passed )

   10949           0 :                 printSummaryRow( "assertions", columns, 1 );
   10950             :             }
   10951           1 :         }
   10952           0 :         void printSummaryRow( std::string const& label, std::vector<SummaryColumn> const& cols, std::size_t row ) {

   10954           0 :                 std::string value = it->rows[row];
   10955           0 :                 if( it->label.empty() ) {
   10956           0 :                     stream << label << ": ";
   10957           0 :                     if( value != "0" )
   10958           0 :                         stream << value;
   10959             :                     else
   10960           0 :                         stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << "- none -";
   10961             :                 }
   10962           0 :                 else if( value != "0" ) {
   10963           0 :                     stream  << Colour( Colour::LightGrey ) << " | ";
   10964           0 :                     stream  << Colour( it->colour )
   10965           0 :                             << value << ' ' << it->label;
   10966             :                 }
   10967             :             }
   10968           0 :             stream << '\n';
   10969           0 :         }
   10970             : 
   10971           3 :         static std::size_t makeRatio( std::size_t number, std::size_t total ) {
   10972           3 :             std::size_t ratio = total > 0 ? CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH * number/ total : 0;
   10973           3 :             return ( ratio == 0 && number > 0 ) ? 1 : ratio;
   10974             :         }
   10975           1 :         static std::size_t& findMax( std::size_t& i, std::size_t& j, std::size_t& k ) {
   10976           1 :             if( i > j && i > k )
   10977           0 :                 return i;
   10978           1 :             else if( j > k )
   10979           0 :                 return j;
   10980             :             else
   10981           1 :                 return k;
   10982             :         }
   10983             : 
   10984           1 :         void printTotalsDivider( Totals const& totals ) {
   10985           1 :             if( totals.testCases.total() > 0 ) {
   10986           1 :                 std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total() );
   10987           1 :                 std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total() );
   10988           1 :                 std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total() );
   10989           1 :                 while( failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 )
   10990           0 :                     findMax( failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio )++;
   10991           3 :                 while( failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 )
   10992           1 :                     findMax( failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio )--;
   10993             : 
   10994           1 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Error ) << std::string( failedRatio, '=' );
   10995           1 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::ResultExpectedFailure ) << std::string( failedButOkRatio, '=' );
   10996           1 :                 if( totals.testCases.allPassed() )
   10997           1 :                     stream << Colour( Colour::ResultSuccess ) << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
   10998             :                 else
   10999           0 :                     stream << Colour( Colour::Success ) << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
   11000             :             }
   11001             :             else {
   11002           0 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << std::string( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1, '=' );
   11003             :             }
   11004           1 :             stream << '\n';
   11005           1 :         }
   11006           0 :         void printSummaryDivider() {
   11007           0 :             stream << getLineOfChars<'-'>() << '\n';
   11008           0 :         }
   11009             :

   11049             : 
   11050           0 :             bool printInfoMessages = true;
   11051             : 
   11052             :             // Drop out if result was successful and we're not printing those
   11053           0 :             if( !m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() && result.isOk() ) {
   11054           0 :                 if( result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning )
   11055           0 :                     return false;
   11056           0 :                 printInfoMessages = false;

   11071             : 
   11072           0 :         virtual void testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& _testRunStats ) {

   11077             : 
   11078             :     private:
   11079           0 :         class AssertionPrinter {
   11080             :             void operator= ( AssertionPrinter const& );
   11081             :         public:
   11082           0 :             AssertionPrinter( std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages )
   11083           0 :             : stream( _stream )
   11084             :             , stats( _stats )
   11085             :             , result( _stats.assertionResult )
   11086             :             , messages( _stats.infoMessages )
   11087           0 :             , itMessage( _stats.infoMessages.begin() )
   11088           0 :             , printInfoMessages( _printInfoMessages )
   11089           0 :             {}
   11090             : 
   11091           0 :             void print() {
   11092           0 :                 printSourceInfo();
   11093             : 
   11094           0 :                 itMessage = messages.begin();
   11095             : 
   11096           0 :                 switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   11097           0 :                     case ResultWas::Ok:
   11098           0 :                         printResultType( Colour::ResultSuccess, passedString() );
   11099           0 :                         printOriginalExpression();
   11100           0 :                         printReconstructedExpression();
   11101           0 :                         if ( ! result.hasExpression() )
   11102           0 :                             printRemainingMessages( Colour::None );
   11103             :                         else
   11104           0 :                             printRemainingMessages();
   11105           0 :                         break;
   11106           0 :                     case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   11107           0 :                         if( result.isOk() )
   11108           0 :                             printResultType( Colour::ResultSuccess, failedString() + std::string( " - but was ok" ) );
   11109             :                         else
   11110           0 :                             printResultType( Colour::Error, failedString() );
   11111           0 :                         printOriginalExpression();
   11112           0 :                         printReconstructedExpression();
   11113           0 :                         printRemainingMessages();
   11114           0 :                         break;
   11115           0 :                     case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   11116           0 :                         printResultType( Colour::Error, failedString() );
   11117           0 :                         printIssue( "unexpected exception with message:" );
   11118           0 :                         printMessage();
   11119           0 :                         printExpressionWas();
   11120           0 :                         printRemainingMessages();
   11121           0 :                         break;
   11122           0 :                     case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   11123           0 :                         printResultType( Colour::Error, failedString() );
   11124           0 :                         printIssue( "fatal error condition with message:" );
   11125           0 :                         printMessage();
   11126           0 :                         printExpressionWas();
   11127           0 :                         printRemainingMessages();
   11128           0 :                         break;
   11129           0 :                     case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   11130           0 :                         printResultType( Colour::Error, failedString() );
   11131           0 :                         printIssue( "expected exception, got none" );
   11132           0 :                         printExpressionWas();
   11133           0 :                         printRemainingMessages();
   11134           0 :                         break;
   11135           0 :                     case ResultWas::Info:
   11136           0 :                         printResultType( Colour::None, "info" );
   11137           0 :                         printMessage();
   11138           0 :                         printRemainingMessages();
   11139           0 :                         break;
   11140           0 :                     case ResultWas::Warning:
   11141           0 :                         printResultType( Colour::None, "warning" );
   11142           0 :                         printMessage();
   11143           0 :                         printRemainingMessages();
   11144           0 :                         break;
   11145           0 :                     case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   11146           0 :                         printResultType( Colour::Error, failedString() );
   11147           0 :                         printIssue( "explicitly" );
   11148           0 :                         printRemainingMessages( Colour::None );
   11149           0 :                         break;
   11150             :                     // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   11151           0 :                     case ResultWas::Unknown:
   11152             :                     case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   11153             :                     case ResultWas::Exception:
   11154           0 :                         printResultType( Colour::Error, "** internal error **" );
   11155           0 :                         break;
   11156             :                 }
   11157           0 :             }
   11158             : 
   11159             :         private:
   11160             :             // Colour::LightGrey
   11161             : 
   11162           0 :             static Colour::Code dimColour() { return Colour::FileName; }
   11163             :

   11165             :             static const char* failedString() { return "FAILED"; }
   11166             :             static const char* passedString() { return "PASSED"; }
   11167             : #else
   11168           0 :             static const char* failedString() { return "failed"; }
   11169           0 :             static const char* passedString() { return "passed"; }
   11170             : #endif
   11171             : 
   11172           0 :             void printSourceInfo() const {
   11173           0 :                 Colour colourGuard( Colour::FileName );
   11174           0 :                 stream << result.getSourceInfo() << ':';
   11175           0 :             }
   11176             : 
   11177           0 :             void printResultType( Colour::Code colour, std::string const& passOrFail ) const {
   11178           0 :                 if( !passOrFail.empty() ) {
   11179             :                     {
   11180           0 :                         Colour colourGuard( colour );
   11181           0 :                         stream << ' ' << passOrFail;
   11182             :                     }
   11183           0 :                     stream << ':';
   11184             :                 }
   11185           0 :             }
   11186             : 
   11187           0 :             void printIssue( std::string const& issue ) const {
   11188           0 :                 stream << ' ' << issue;
   11189           0 :             }
   11190             : 
   11191           0 :             void printExpressionWas() {
   11192           0 :                 if( result.hasExpression() ) {
   11193           0 :                     stream << ';';
   11194             :                     {
   11195           0 :                         Colour colour( dimColour() );
   11196           0 :                         stream << " expression was:";
   11197             :                     }
   11198           0 :                     printOriginalExpression();
   11199             :                 }
   11200           0 :             }
   11201             : 
   11202           0 :             void printOriginalExpression() const {
   11203           0 :                 if( result.hasExpression() ) {
   11204           0 :                     stream << ' ' << result.getExpression();
   11205             :                 }
   11206           0 :             }
   11207             : 
   11208           0 :             void printReconstructedExpression() const {
   11209           0 :                 if( result.hasExpandedExpression() ) {
   11210             :                     {
   11211           0 :                         Colour colour( dimColour() );
   11212           0 :                         stream << " for: ";
   11213             :                     }
   11214           0 :                     stream << result.getExpandedExpression();
   11215             :                 }
   11216           0 :             }
   11217             : 
   11218           0 :             void printMessage() {
   11219           0 :                 if ( itMessage != messages.end() ) {
   11220           0 :                     stream << " '" << itMessage->message << '\'';
   11221           0 :                     ++itMessage;
   11222             :                 }
   11223           0 :             }
   11224             : 
   11225           0 :             void printRemainingMessages( Colour::Code colour = dimColour() ) {
   11226           0 :                 if ( itMessage == messages.end() )
   11227           0 :                     return;
   11228             : 
   11229             :                 // using messages.end() directly yields compilation error:
   11230           0 :                 std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator itEnd = messages.end();
   11231           0 :                 const std::size_t N = static_cast<std::size_t>( std::distance( itMessage, itEnd ) );
   11232             : 
   11233             :                 {
   11234           0 :                     Colour colourGuard( colour );
   11235           0 :                     stream << " with " << pluralise( N, "message" ) << ':';
   11236             :                 }
   11237             : 
   11238           0 :                 for(; itMessage != itEnd; ) {
   11239             :                     // If this assertion is a warning ignore any INFO messages
   11240           0 :                     if( printInfoMessages || itMessage->type != ResultWas::Info ) {
   11241           0 :                         stream << " '" << itMessage->message << '\'';
   11242           0 :                         if ( ++itMessage != itEnd ) {
   11243           0 :                             Colour colourGuard( dimColour() );
   11244           0 :                             stream << " and";
   11245             :                         }
   11246             :                     }
   11247             :                 }
   11248             :             }
   11249             : 
   11250             :         private:
   11251             :             std::ostream& stream;
   11252             :             AssertionStats const& stats;
   11253             :             AssertionResult const& result;
   11254             :             std::vector<MessageInfo> messages;
   11255             :             std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator itMessage;
   11256             :             bool printInfoMessages;
   11257             :         };
   11258             : 
   11259             :         // Colour, message variants:
   11260             :         // - white: No tests ran.
   11261             :         // -   red: Failed [both/all] N test cases, failed [both/all] M assertions.
   11262             :         // - white: Passed [both/all] N test cases (no assertions).
   11263             :         // -   red: Failed N tests cases, failed M assertions.
   11264             :         // - green: Passed [both/all] N tests cases with M assertions.
   11265             : 
   11266           0 :         std::string bothOrAll( std::size_t count ) const {
   11267           0 :             return count == 1 ? std::string() : count == 2 ? "both " : "all " ;
   11268             :         }
   11269             : 
   11270           0 :         void printTotals( const Totals& totals ) const {
   11271           0 :             if( totals.testCases.total() == 0 ) {
   11272           0 :                 stream << "No tests ran.";
   11273             :             }
   11274           0 :             else if( totals.testCases.failed == totals.testCases.total() ) {
   11275           0 :                 Colour colour( Colour::ResultError );
   11276             :                 const std::string qualify_assertions_failed =
   11277           0 :                     totals.assertions.failed == totals.assertions.total() ?
   11278           0 :                         bothOrAll( totals.assertions.failed ) : std::string();
   11279           0 :                 stream <<
   11280           0 :                     "Failed " << bothOrAll( totals.testCases.failed )
   11281           0 :                               << pluralise( totals.testCases.failed, "test case"  ) << ", "
   11282           0 :                     "failed " << qualify_assertions_failed <<
   11283           0 :                                  pluralise( totals.assertions.failed, "assertion" ) << '.';
   11284             :             }
   11285           0 :             else if( totals.assertions.total() == 0 ) {
   11286           0 :                 stream <<
   11287           0 :                     "Passed " << bothOrAll( totals.testCases.total() )
   11288           0 :                               << pluralise( totals.testCases.total(), "test case" )
   11289           0 :                               << " (no assertions).";
   11290             :             }
   11291           0 :             else if( totals.assertions.failed ) {
   11292           0 :                 Colour colour( Colour::ResultError );
   11293           0 :                 stream <<
   11294           0 :                     "Failed " << pluralise( totals.testCases.failed, "test case"  ) << ", "
   11295           0 :                     "failed " << pluralise( totals.assertions.failed, "assertion" ) << '.';
   11296             :             }
   11297             :             else {
   11298           0 :                 Colour colour( Colour::ResultSuccess );
   11299           0 :                 stream <<
   11300           0 :                     "Passed " << bothOrAll( totals.testCases.passed )
   11301           0 :                               << pluralise( totals.testCases.passed, "test case"  ) <<
   11302           0 :                     " with "  << pluralise( totals.assertions.passed, "assertion" ) << '.';
   11303             :             }
   11304           0 :         }
   11305             :     };

   11420             : //////
   11421             : 
   11422             : // If this config identifier is defined then all CATCH macros are prefixed with CATCH_
   11423             : #ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL
   11424             : 
   11425             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_FAST_COMPILE)
   11426             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE( expr ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_NO_TRY( "CATCH_REQUIRE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, expr )
   11427             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE( expr ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_NO_TRY( "CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, expr )
   11428             : #else
   11429             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE( expr ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_REQUIRE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, expr )

   11431             : #endif
   11432             : 
   11433             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS( expr ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, "", expr )

   11436             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_NOTHROW( expr ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( "CATCH_REQUIRE_NOTHROW", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, expr )
   11437             :

   11472             : #else

   11479             :     #define CATCH_FAIL_CHECK( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_FAIL_CHECK", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitFailure, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, msg )
   11480             :     #define CATCH_SUCCEED( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_SUCCEED", Catch::ResultWas::Ok, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, msg )
   11481             : #endif
   11482             : #define CATCH_ANON_TEST_CASE() INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE( "", "" )
